translated: how is it that there are the different divisions of the five life-journeys of the hells, animals, the world of Yama, gods, and humans?

original: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su brjod pa'ang ci las gyur /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su brjod pa'ang ci las gyur /
translated: How is it that there are those called stream-enterers, once-returners, nonreturners, arhats, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, and bhagavān buddhas?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: sems can gang phyin ci log las byung ba'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las mngon par 'du byed pa de dag 'di lta bu'i skye mched mngon par bsgrubs shing las kyi rnam par smin pa phung po'i gzhi can /
analyzed: sems can gang phyin ci log las byung ba'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las mngon par 'du byed pa de dag 'di lta bu'i skye mched mngon par bsgrubs shing las kyi rnam par smin pa phung po'i gzhi can /
translated: those sentient beings who create physical, verbal, and mental actions that arise from error establish such sense-spheres and the basis of the aggregates that are the ripening of karma.

original: rnam par rtog pa las byung ba yongs su bzung ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa las byung ba yongs su bzung ste /
translated: “They are born in the hells, as animals, in the world of Yama, and as gods and humans.

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / lha dang mi'i 'gro ba mngon par bsgrub bo; ;tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / lha dang mi'i 'gro ba mngon par bsgrub bo; ;tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: gang khyod kyis 'di skad du rgyun du zhugs par brjod pa ci las gyur /
analyzed: gang khyod kyis 'di skad du rgyun du zhugs par brjod pa ci las gyur /
translated: you asked, ‘What is the reason for the designation of a stream enterer?

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su brjod pa ci las gyur ces zer ba ni /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su brjod pa ci las gyur ces zer ba ni /
translated: What is the reason for the designations of a once-returner, a non-returner, a worthy one, a pratyekabuddha, a bodhisattva, and a tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete buddha?’

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽rnam par mi rtog pa las rgyun du zhugs par brjod do //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu / rnam par mi rtog pa las rgyun du zhugs par brjod do //
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,🔽a stream enterer is designated due to nonconceptuality.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa las rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bur brjod do //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa las rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bur brjod do //
translated: The fruit of a stream enterer is designated due to nonconceptuality.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa las lan gcig phyir 'ong ba @77a *//
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa las lan gcig phyir 'ong ba @77a *//
translated: from nonconceptuality, the once-returner,

original: dang; phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: dang; phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid du brjod do //
translated: the nonreturner, and the state of an arhat are spoken of.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa las rang sangs rgyas dang / rang byang chub tu brjod do //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa las rang sangs rgyas dang / rang byang chub tu brjod do //
translated: from nonconceptuality, the pratyekabuddha and the pratyekabuddha’s awakening are spoken of.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa las sangs rgyas su brjod do //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa las sangs rgyas su brjod do //
translated: from nonconceptuality, the buddha is spoken of.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa las byang chub tu brjod do //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa las byang chub tu brjod do //
translated: from nonconceptuality, awakening is spoken of.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'das pa'i dus na /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na /
translated: in the past

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' zhing rnam par rtog pa spangs par gyur to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' zhing rnam par rtog pa spangs par gyur to //
translated: as many buddha bhagavāns, tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened ones as there were have appeared, those buddha bhagavāns were without concepts and had abandoned concepts.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' zhing rnam par rtog pa spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' zhing rnam par rtog pa spangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The blessed buddhas, the tathāgatas, the arhats, the completely enlightened ones, who will appear in the future, those blessed buddhas will also be free from conceptualization and will have abandoned conceptualization.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus na phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang rnam par
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus na phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang rnam par
translated: the blessed buddhas who have attained unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in the world systems of the ten directions in the present, those blessed buddhas are also

original: rtog pa mi mnga' zhing rnam par rtog pa spangs pa sha stag go /
analyzed: rtog pa mi mnga' zhing rnam par rtog pa spangs pa sha stag go /
translated: free from conceptualization and have abandoned conceptualization.

original: de ltar tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: de ltar tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: In this way, Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: rnam grangs des chos thams cad rnam par rtog pa med pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha'i de @77b bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi de bzhin nyid brtson par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs des chos thams cad rnam par rtog pa med pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha'i de @77b bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi de bzhin nyid brtson par bya ste /
translated: By this enumeration, one should strive for the suchness of all phenomena, the suchness of the limit of reality, and the suchness of the dharma-realm.

original: rnam par rtog pa med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know them to be non-conceptual.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya ste /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva should practice the non-conceptual perfection of wisdom in this way.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: By practicing the non-conceptual perfection of wisdom,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: one will fully awaken to all dharmas that are non-conceptual.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines,

original: le'u bzhi bcu brgyad do ////
analyzed: le'u bzhi bcu brgyad do ////
translated: Chapter Forty-eight.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines

original: bam po lnga bcu drug pa /
analyzed: bam po lnga bcu drug pa /
translated: Chapter 56

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus /
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatīputra

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said this to the venerable Su­bhūti:

original: kye ma tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: kye ma tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “O Venerable Su­bhūti!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni snying po la spyod pa'o //🔽de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni snying po la spyod pa'o // de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: The bodhisattva great beings who practice the perfection of wisdom practice the essence.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: ” When this had been said, the venerable Su­bhūti addressed the venerable Śāradvatīputra as follows:

original: kye ma tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: kye ma tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “O Venerable Śāradvatīputra!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni snying po med pa la spyod pa'o //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni snying po med pa la spyod pa'o // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The bodhisattva great beings who practice the perfection of wisdom practice the insubstantial.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: If you ask why, Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni snying po med pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni snying po med pa'o //
translated: it is because the perfection of wisdom is insubstantial.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu @78a *//
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu @78a *//
translated: the perfection of meditative stability,🔽the perfection of perseverance,🔽the perfection of patience,🔽and the perfection of ethical discipline.🔽

original: phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni snying po med pa'o //
analyzed: phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni snying po med pa'o //
translated: the perfection of meditative stability, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity are insubstantial.

original: nang stong pa nyid ni snying po med pa'o //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid ni snying po med pa'o //
translated: The emptiness of internal phenomena is insubstantial.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni snying po med pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni snying po med pa'o //
translated: Up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is insubstantial.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams ni snying po med pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams ni snying po med pa'o //
translated: The applications of mindfulness are insubstantial.

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni snying po med pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni snying po med pa'o //
translated: The right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and the eightfold noble path are insubstantial.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar ni snying po med pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar ni snying po med pa'o //
translated: Up to the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas are insubstantial.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni snying po med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni snying po med pa'o //
translated: up to the knowledge of all aspects is insubstantial.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ni snying po med pa nyid kyang mi dmigs shing yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ni snying po med pa nyid kyang mi dmigs shing yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na /
translated: Because bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom do not apprehend and do not see even insubstantiality.

original: snying po dmigs pa lta ga la yod /
analyzed: snying po dmigs pa lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they apprehend substantiality?

original: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu shin tu mang ba dag 'di snyam du gyur te /
analyzed: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu shin tu mang ba dag 'di snyam du gyur te /
translated: Then the thought occurred to a great many gods living in the desire realm and the form realm:

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Those sons of a good family or

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ji skad du bstan pa 'di la spyod pa dang / don 'di la spyod kyang yang dag pa'i mtha' gang mngon du byas pas /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ji skad du bstan pa 'di la spyod pa dang / don 'di la spyod kyang yang dag pa'i mtha' gang mngon du byas pas /
translated: those daughters of a good family who have produced the thought of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening and who practice this deep perfection of wisdom as it has been taught, and who practice this topic, even though they do not actualize the very limit of reality,

original: nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: the level of the śrāvakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas par @78b 'gyur ba'i yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa de dag ni phyag bya ba'i gnas te /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas par @78b 'gyur ba'i yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa de dag ni phyag bya ba'i gnas te /
translated: or the level of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: rnam grangs des kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos kyi mnyam pa nyid 'di mngon par mi byed pa de dag ni phyag bya bar 'os pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs des kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos kyi mnyam pa nyid 'di mngon par mi byed pa de dag ni phyag bya bar 'os pa'o //
translated: For this reason, too, those bodhisattva great beings who do not actualize this sameness of dharmas are worthy of homage.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Su­bhūti addressed the divine princes as follows:

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: “Divine princes!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la ni chos kyi mnyam pa nyid gang mngon du byas pas /🔽nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la ni chos kyi mnyam pa nyid gang mngon du byas pas / nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings who do not actualize the sameness of dharmas🔽in order to abide on the level of the śrāvakas

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas par 'gyur ba de mngon du mi bya ba de ni mi dka'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas par 'gyur ba de mngon du mi bya ba de ni mi dka'o //
translated: or the level of the pratyekabuddhas, that is not difficult.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes!

original: sems can tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o zhes go cha bgos la /
analyzed: sems can tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o zhes go cha bgos la /
translated: “I will lead to complete nirvāṇa an infinite, countless, immeasurable number of sentient beings.”

original: gang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba'i sems can de dag shin tu mi dmigs pa ni de dag la de bas dka' ste /🔽de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can thams cad gdul bar bya'o zhes /
analyzed: gang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba'i sems can de dag shin tu mi dmigs pa ni de dag la de bas dka' ste / de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can thams cad gdul bar bya'o zhes /
translated: But those sentient beings who are to be led to complete nirvāṇa are not at all apprehended.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices in this way has set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, thinking, ‘I will tame all sentient beings.’

original: gang sems can gdul bar sems pa de ni nam mkha' gdul bar sems pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gang sems can gdul bar sems pa de ni nam mkha' gdul bar sems pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: But that taming of sentient beings is like the taming of space.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽nam mkha' dben pa'i phyir sems can dben par blta'o //🔽nam mkha' stong pa nyid kyi phyir sems can stong pa nyid du blta'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / nam mkha' dben pa'i phyir sems can dben par blta'o // nam mkha' stong pa nyid kyi phyir sems can stong pa nyid du blta'o //
translated: And why is that?🔽Because of the emptiness of space, sentient beings should be seen as empty.🔽Because of the emptiness of space, sentient beings should be seen as empty.

original: nam mkha' snying po med pa'i phyir sems can snying po med par @79a *//
analyzed: nam mkha' snying po med pa'i phyir sems can snying po med par @79a *//
translated: Because of the corelessness of space, sentient beings should be seen as coreless.

original: blta'o // nam mkha' gsog gi phyir sems can gsog tu blta'o //
analyzed: blta'o // nam mkha' gsog gi phyir sems can gsog tu blta'o //
translated: One should see sentient beings as empty because of the emptiness of space.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: “Divine princes,

original: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sems can med pa rnams kyi don du go cha gyon pa de dag ni dka' ba byed pa ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sems can med pa rnams kyi don du go cha gyon pa de dag ni dka' ba byed pa ste /
translated: for this reason, those bodhisattva great beings who don the armor for the sake of nonexistent sentient beings are doing something difficult.

original: gang sems can rnams kyi don du go cha gyon pa de dag ni nam mkha' dang brtsad par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: gang sems can rnams kyi don du go cha gyon pa de dag ni nam mkha' dang brtsad par 'dod pa ste /
translated: Those who don the armor for the sake of sentient beings are wishing to dispute with space.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos go cha de'ang bgos la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos go cha de'ang bgos la /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings don that armor

original: sems can gang gi don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos go cha bgos pa'i sems can de dag kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sems can gang gi don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos go cha bgos pa'i sems can de dag kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: and do not apprehend any sentient beings for whose sake the bodhisattva great beings don the armor.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: sems can dben pa'i phyir go cha dben par blta'o //
analyzed: sems can dben pa'i phyir go cha dben par blta'o //
translated: One should see the armor as isolated because of the isolation of sentient beings.

original: gal te de ltar bstan pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te de ltar bstan pa'i tshe /
translated: If, when this is being taught,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhum par mi 'gyur na; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhum par mi 'gyur na; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: If a bodhisattva great being does not get discouraged, then a bodhisattva great being practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs dben pa'i phyir sems can dben pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dben pa'i phyir sems can dben pa'o //
translated: Because beings are isolated because form is isolated.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dben pa'i phyir sems can dben pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dben pa'i phyir sems can dben pa'o //
translated: Because beings are isolated because feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are isolated.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dben pa'i phyir sems can dben pa'o; ;pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dben pa'i phyir sems can dben pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dben pa'i phyir sems can dben pa'o; ;pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dben pa'i phyir sems can dben pa'o //
translated: Because beings are isolated because the sense spheres, elements, and dependent origination are isolated. Because beings are isolated because the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the dharmas on the side of awakening are isolated.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco @79b brgyad kyi bar du dben pa'i phyir sems can dben pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco @79b brgyad kyi bar du dben pa'i phyir sems can dben pa'o //
translated: Because beings are isolated because the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are isolated.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dben pa'i phyir sems can dben pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dben pa'i phyir sems can dben pa'o //
translated: “Sentient beings are isolated because of the isolation of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gzugs dben pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dben pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is isolated because of the isolation of form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dben pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dben pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is isolated because of the isolation of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dben pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dben pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is isolated because of the isolation of the constituents and the dependent originations.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dben pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dben pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is isolated because of the isolation of the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: sangs rgyas kyis chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dben pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dben pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is isolated because of the isolation of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dben pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dben pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is isolated because of the isolation of all dharmas up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Gods,

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad dben par bshad pa la sems mi 'jum yongs su zhum par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad dben par bshad pa la sems mi 'jum yongs su zhum par mi 'gyur la /
translated: if the mind of a bodhisattva great being does not draw back, does not tense up, and does not get cowed when the explanation of the isolation of all dharmas is being given,

original: de'i yang 'jigs par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i yang 'jigs par mi 'gyur na /
translated: and if he does not get frightened,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o //
translated: then that bodhisattva great being is practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Lord said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: rab 'byor / ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu @80a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu @80a *//
translated: “Subhūti, why does a bodhisattva great being not draw back from the perfection of wisdom?🔽Why does he not tense up?🔽Why does he not get cowed?

original: phyin pa la zhum par mi 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: phyin pa la zhum par mi 'gyur ba yin /
translated: Why does he not get frightened?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: chos thams cad ma mchis pa'i slad du /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma mchis pa'i slad du /
translated: because all dharmas are nonexistent.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhum par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhum par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva does not become disheartened in the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: chos thams cad dben pa dang / zhi ba dang / ma skyes pa'i slad du /
analyzed: chos thams cad dben pa dang / zhi ba dang / ma skyes pa'i slad du /
translated: because all phenomena are void, peaceful, and unborn,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhum par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhum par mi 'gyur te /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva does not become disheartened in the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das de'i slad du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de'i slad du /
translated: Blessed One, for that reason

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhum par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhum par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva does not become disheartened in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de ni 'di ltar gang zhum par 'gyur ba dang / gang gis zhum par 'gyur ba dang / gang la zhum par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag thams cad ni ma mchis pa ste dmigs su ma mchis so //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gang zhum par 'gyur ba dang / gang gis zhum par 'gyur ba dang / gang la zhum par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag thams cad ni ma mchis pa ste dmigs su ma mchis so //
translated: it is because all those phenomena—that which would become disheartened, that by which it would become disheartened, and that in which it would become disheartened—are non-existent and cannot be apprehended.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de skad du bshad pa la mi 'jum mi 'gong zhing tshi chad pa dang / sgyid lug par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de skad du bshad pa la mi 'jum mi 'gong zhing tshi chad pa dang / sgyid lug par mi 'gyur la /
translated: If a bodhisattva great being does not become disheartened, does not become cowed, does not become timid,

original: mi 'jigs mi dngangs skrag par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: mi 'jigs mi dngangs skrag par mi 'gyur na /
translated: does not become terrified, does not become terrified even more,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lags so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lags so //
translated: then he practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de ni 'di ltar gang zhum par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gang zhum par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: it is because all those things that might become disheartened,

original: gang gis zhum par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gang gis zhum par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: by which one might become disheartened,

original: gang la zhum par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag thams cad ni ma mchis pa ste /
analyzed: gang la zhum par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag thams cad ni ma mchis pa ste /
translated: and in which one might become disheartened are non-existent.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de ltar spyod @80b pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dbang po dang bcas /
analyzed: de ltar spyod @80b pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dbang po dang bcas /
translated: a bodhisattva great being who practices like that will be bowed to by the gods with Indra,🔽with Prajāpatī,

original: tshangs pa dang bcas /🔽skye dgu'i bdag po dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis phyag bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa dang bcas / skye dgu'i bdag po dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis phyag bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and with Brahmā.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, it is so!

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni dbang po dang bcas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni dbang po dang bcas /
translated: Subhūti, not only are the gods, with Indra,

original: tshangs pa dang bcas /🔽skye dgu'i bdag po dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis phyag bya bar yang ma zad de /
analyzed: tshangs pa dang bcas / skye dgu'i bdag po dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis phyag bya bar yang ma zad de /
translated: with Brahmā,🔽and with Prajāpati, bowing down to the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: gang 'phags pa mngon par 'phags pa'i kha dog dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gang 'phags pa mngon par 'phags pa'i kha dog dang ldan pa /
translated: but also the gods with the color of noble distinction,

original: dge rgyas dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha rnams kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la phyag bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge rgyas dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha rnams kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la phyag bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the gods of the Ābhāsvara, Śubhakṛtsna, and Śuddhāvāsa classes bow down to the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom in that way.

original: rab 'byor / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas grangs med tshad med pa gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong bde dag kyang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas grangs med tshad med pa gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong bde dag kyang /
translated: Subhūti, the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas, countless and limitless in number, who are present, living, and teaching in the world systems of the ten directions,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de la dgongs pa mdzad de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de la dgongs pa mdzad de /
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha, knowing his thoughts, his higher intention and his patience, has declared his pratyekabuddha­hood.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni /
translated: “Kauśika, it is because the bodhisattva great beings who practice the perfection of wisdom do not apprehend a bodhisattva, and do not apprehend the word ‘bodhisattva.’

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: They do not apprehend the perfection of giving, and do not apprehend the word ‘perfection of giving.’

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa @81a *//
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa @81a *//
translated: They do not apprehend the perfection of morality, perfection of patience, perfection of perseverance, perfection of concentration,

original: dang; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //🔽nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dang; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o // nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: and perfection of wisdom, and do not apprehend the words ‘perfection of wisdom.’🔽They do not apprehend inner emptiness, and do not apprehend the words ‘inner emptiness.’

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: They do not apprehend . . . up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, and do not apprehend the words ‘emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.’

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the perfection of the thirty-seven aspects of awakening.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang; tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang; tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the perfection of the four noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, and the formless absorptions.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the perfection of the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the aspects of deeper discernment, the meditative absorption of the state of composure that is a cessation, and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the perfection of the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o zhes bya bar dgongs par mdzad do //🔽rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa gang la /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o zhes bya bar dgongs par mdzad do // rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa gang la /
translated: up to the knowledge of all modes.🔽Subhuti : A Bodhisattva, a great being, who courses in perfect wisdom,🔽and who is mindful of the perfection of wisdom, and who is not lacking in the thought of the knowledge of all modes, he, O Lord, is a Bodhisattva, a great being, who is mindful of the perfection of wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dgongs pa mdzad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni @81b sangs rgyas su 'gyur par zhugs par rig par bya'o //🔽rab 'byor / gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dgongs pa mdzad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni @81b sangs rgyas su 'gyur par zhugs par rig par bya'o // rab 'byor / gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag na /
translated: The Lord : A Bodhisattva, a great being, who courses in perfect wisdom, and who is mindful of the perfection of wisdom, and who is not lacking in the thought of the knowledge of all modes, he, Subhuti, is a Bodhisattva, a great being, who is mindful of the perfection of wisdom.

original: sems can gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad bdud sdig to can du gyur te /
analyzed: sems can gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad bdud sdig to can du gyur te /
translated: Subhuti : If, O Lord, all dharmas are like a dream, like an echo, like an image, like a reflected image, like a mirage, like a magical creation, like a phantom, then how can a Bodhisattva, a great being, who courses in perfect wisdom, apprehend an increase or decrease of the wholesome roots of all beings, and how can he, having apprehended it, dedicate it to the supreme enlightenment?🔽The Lord : Here a Bodhisattva, a great being, who courses in perfect wisdom, should train himself thus:

original: bdud sdig to can de dag re res kyang de snyed kyi bdud sdig to can mngon par sprul kyang /
analyzed: bdud sdig to can de dag re res kyang de snyed kyi bdud sdig to can mngon par sprul kyang /
translated: as all dharmas are like a dream, like an echo, like an image, like a reflected image, like a mirage, like a magical creation, like a phantom, so also are the wholesome roots which are dedicated to the supreme enlightenment.

original: de dag thams cad kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la bar chad bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la bar chad bya bar mi nus so //
translated: all of them are unable to obstruct that bodhisattva great being.

original: rab 'byor / chos gnyis dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bdud sdig to can rnams kyis mi thub pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos gnyis dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bdud sdig to can rnams kyis mi thub pa yin te /
translated: “Subhūti, the māras, the wicked ones, are unable to defeat a bodhisattva great being who has two dharmas.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: des chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes bya bar rnam par bltas pa yin /
analyzed: des chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes bya bar rnam par bltas pa yin /
translated: He has looked upon all dharmas as empty.

original: sems can thams cad kyang yongs su ma btang ba yin te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang yongs su ma btang ba yin te /
translated: He has not abandoned any sentient being.

original: rab 'byor / chos 'di gnyis dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bdud sdig to can rnams kyis mi thub pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos 'di gnyis dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bdud sdig to can rnams kyis mi thub pa yin no //
translated: Subhūti, the māras, the wicked ones, are unable to defeat a bodhisattva great being who has those two dharmas.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos gnyis dang ldan pa ni bdud sdig to can rnams kyis mi thub pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos gnyis dang ldan pa ni bdud sdig to can rnams kyis mi thub pa yin te /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the māras, the wicked ones, are unable to defeat a bodhisattva great being who has two dharmas and practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: ji skad du smras pa de bzhin du byed pa yin /
analyzed: ji skad du smras pa de bzhin du byed pa yin /
translated: He does what he says.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dgongs pa yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dgongs pa yin te /
translated: He is considered by the Lord Buddhas.

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos de gnyis dang ldan pa ni bdud sdig to can @82a *//🔽rnams kyis mi thub pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos de gnyis dang ldan pa ni bdud sdig to can @82a *// rnams kyis mi thub pa yin no //
translated: Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of wisdom, endowed with these two dharmas, cannot be overcome by Mara, the Evil One.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du ni lha'i bu rnams kyang 'ong bar sems so //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du ni lha'i bu rnams kyang 'ong bar sems so //
translated: Subhuti, the gods also think of coming to the place where the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses thus, is staying,

original: bsnyen bkur ba dang / yongs su dri ba dang / kun tu dri ba'ang byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur ba dang / yongs su dri ba dang / kun tu dri ba'ang byed par 'gyur te /
translated: to honor him, to pay him homage, to greet him courteously, and to question him and to converse with him.

original: rigs kyi bu khyod sangs rgyas kyi byang chub myur du thob par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod sangs rgyas kyi byang chub myur du thob par 'gyur gyi /
translated: 'You, son of good family, will soon win full enlightenment.

original: de bas na rigs kyi bu khyod kyis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bas na rigs kyi bu khyod kyis 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, son of good family, you should be one who is intent on the perfection of wisdom, who courses in the perfection of wisdom.

original: stong pa nyid kyis rnam par spyod pa dang / mtshan ma med pas rnam par spyod pa dang / smon pa med pas rnam pa spyod pa de nyid kyis rnam par spyod par gyis shig /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis rnam par spyod pa dang / mtshan ma med pas rnam par spyod pa dang / smon pa med pas rnam pa spyod pa de nyid kyis rnam par spyod par gyis shig /
translated: You should practice emptiness, practice signlessness, and practice wishlessness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis rnam par spyod pa des rnam par spyad pa dang / sems can mgon med pa rnams kyi mgon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis rnam par spyod pa des rnam par spyad pa dang / sems can mgon med pa rnams kyi mgon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Son of noble family, through this practice, you will become a protector for sentient beings without a protector.

original: sems can skyabs med pa rnams kyi skyabs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can skyabs med pa rnams kyi skyabs su 'gyur ro //
translated: You will become a refuge for sentient beings without a refuge.

original: sems can dpung gnyen med pa rnams kyi dpung gnyen du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can dpung gnyen med pa rnams kyi dpung gnyen du 'gyur ro //
translated: You will become a friend for sentient beings without a friend.

original: sems can gnas med pa rnams kyi gnas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gnas med pa rnams kyi gnas su 'gyur ro //
translated: You will become a home for sentient beings without a home.

original: sems can rten med pa rnams kyi rten du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can rten med pa rnams kyi rten du 'gyur ro //
translated: You will become a support for sentient beings without a support.

original: sems can gling med pa rnams kyi gling du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gling med pa rnams kyi gling du 'gyur ro //
translated: You will become an island for sentient beings without an island.

original: sems can mun par gyur pa rnams kyi snang bar 'gyur ro zhes de la spro ba bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can mun par gyur pa rnams kyi snang bar 'gyur ro zhes de la spro ba bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: You will become a light for sentient beings in the dark.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med pa dag na /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med pa dag na /
translated: in the limitless, countless world systems

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis yongs su bskor te bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de @82b dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis yongs su bskor te bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de @82b dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: the lord buddhas who are dwelling, maintaining themselves, living, and teaching the Dharma, surrounded by their communities of monks and by their communities of bodhisattvas,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: they too,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i ming dang rigs yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa ched du brjod pa mdzad de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i ming dang rigs yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa ched du brjod pa mdzad de /
translated: the lord buddhas, will teach the Dharma by way of proclaiming the name and clan of that bodhisattva great being who is endowed with the qualities of the perfection of wisdom,🔽and they will utter a cry of ‘bravo!’

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / nga da ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rin chen dpal gyi ming yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa ched du brjod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gtsug phud kyi ming yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa ched du brjod pa dang /
analyzed: dper na / nga da ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rin chen dpal gyi ming yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa ched du brjod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gtsug phud kyi ming yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa ched du brjod pa dang /
translated: For example, I teach the Dharma by proclaiming the name of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Ratnaprabha, and I proclaim the Dharma by proclaiming the name of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Śikhī.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa'i zhabs 'bring na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa'i zhabs 'bring na /
translated: I am a follower of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly awakened Buddha Akṣobhya,

original: tshangs pa'i spyad pa spyod pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba de dag gi ming yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa ched du brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i spyad pa spyod pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba de dag gi ming yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa ched du brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: who practices celibacy and is never separate from the perfection of wisdom.”

original: shar phyogs kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag kyang de na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang ji snyed cig tshangs pa'i spyad pa spyod cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba de dag la spro bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston te /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag kyang de na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang ji snyed cig tshangs pa'i spyad pa spyod cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba de dag la spro bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston te /
translated: The lord buddhas in the eastern direction who are present, live happily, and teach the Dharma also, in order to inspire the bodhisattva great beings who are practicing celibacy and are not separated from the perfection of wisdom, teach the Dharma by way of rejoicing.

original: ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa mdzad do //🔽lho dang @83a *//
analyzed: ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa mdzad do // lho dang @83a *//
translated: They also make proclamations of rejoicing.🔽The lord buddhas in the southern,

original: nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang /
analyzed: nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang /
translated: western, northern, northeastern, southeastern, southwestern, northwestern, lower, and upper directions who are present, live happily, and teach the Dharma also, in order to inspire the bodhisattva great beings who are practicing celibacy and are not separated from the perfection of wisdom, teach the Dharma by way of rejoicing.🔽They also make proclamations of rejoicing.

original: chos ston pa de dag kyang de na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang ji snyed cig tshangs pa'i spyad pa spyod cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba de dag la spro bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston te /
analyzed: chos ston pa de dag kyang de na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang ji snyed cig tshangs pa'i spyad pa spyod cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba de dag la spro bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston te /
translated: They also teach the Dharma to those bodhisattva great beings who are practicing celibate conduct and are not separated from the perfection of wisdom, by way of delighting them.

original: ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa mdzad do //🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /🔽thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob kyi bar du byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag la'ang /
analyzed: ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa mdzad do // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob kyi bar du byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag la'ang /
translated: And they also make proclamations of rejoicing.🔽They also teach the Dharma to those bodhisattva great beings who, starting from the production of the first thought,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag spro bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag spro bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston te /
translated: up to the attainment of the knowledge of all aspects, are purifying the path to awakening, by way of delighting them.

original: ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa mdzad do //
analyzed: ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa mdzad do //
translated: And they also make proclamations of rejoicing.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sangs rgyas kyi tshul rgyun mi 'chad pa'i don du zhugs pa de dag ni dka' ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sangs rgyas kyi tshul rgyun mi 'chad pa'i don du zhugs pa de dag ni dka' ba byed pa'o //
translated: “Subhūti, those bodhisattva great beings who have set out for the sake of not interrupting the way of the buddhas are the ones who do what is difficult.

original: gsol ba / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol ba / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” Subhūti said, “Lord,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po slar ldog pa'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po slar ldog pa'am /
translated: do those lord buddhas teach the Dharma by way of mentioning the names of those bodhisattva great beings who are irreversible

original: slar mi ldog pa'am /🔽gang gi ming yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa mdzad /
analyzed: slar mi ldog pa'am / gang gi ming yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa mdzad /
translated: or those who are reversible?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal @83b pa; rab 'byor /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog pa las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal @83b pa; rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog pa las /
translated: ” The Lord said, “Subhūti,🔽there are bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom who are irreversible

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'ang yod /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'ang yod /
translated: and there are bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom who are not irreversible.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni lung ma bstan pa las /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni lung ma bstan pa las /
translated: There are bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom who are not predicted

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'ang yod de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'ang yod de /
translated: and there are bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom who are predicted.

original: de dag la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag spro bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de dag la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag spro bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa mdzad do //
translated: Those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, teach the Dharma to those Bodhisattvas, the great beings, and they also utter these meaningful expressions.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de dag gang lags /
analyzed: de dag gang lags /
translated: who are they?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa'i rjes su slob pa'i tshul gyis rnam par spyod pa de dag la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag spro bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa'ang ched
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa'i rjes su slob pa'i tshul gyis rnam par spyod pa de dag la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag spro bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa'ang ched
translated: “Subhūti, those Bodhisattva great beings who, when practicing the conduct of a Bodhisattva,

original: du brjod pa mdzad do //
analyzed: du brjod pa mdzad do //
translated: practice in the manner of following the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Akṣobhya, those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, teach the Dharma to those Bodhisattvas, the great beings, and they also utter these meaningful expressions.

original: rab 'byor / gang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rin chen dpal gyi rjes su slob pa'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa de dag la'ang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rin chen dpal gyi rjes su slob pa'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa de dag la'ang /
translated: Subhuti, those Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas who practice the Bodhisattva conduct by following the way of the Bodhisattva Ratnaprabha,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag spro bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa mdzad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag spro bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa mdzad do //
translated: those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, teach the Dharma to them in a way that delights them, and they also utter this exclamation.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing chos thams cad skye ba med par mos kyang mi @84a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing chos thams cad skye ba med par mos kyang mi @84a *//
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, those Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas who practice the perfection of wisdom and believe that all phenomena are unborn,

original: skye ba'i chos la bzod pa ma thob pa /
analyzed: skye ba'i chos la bzod pa ma thob pa /
translated: but have not yet attained the acceptance that phenomena are unborn,

original: chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes bya ba dang / chos thams cad zhi ba'o zhes bya ba dang / chos thams cad gsog gsob ster ga lus pa'o zhes bya ba dang / snying po med pa'o zhes bya bar mos kyang /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes bya ba dang / chos thams cad zhi ba'o zhes bya ba dang / chos thams cad gsog gsob ster ga lus pa'o zhes bya ba dang / snying po med pa'o zhes bya bar mos kyang /
translated: who believe that all phenomena are empty, that all phenomena are peaceful, that all phenomena are false, hollow, void, and essenceless,

original: mi skye ba'i chos pa bzod pa ma thob pa de dag la'ang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag spro bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa mdzad do //🔽rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ming yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa mdzad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis ni nyan thos kyi
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos pa bzod pa ma thob pa de dag la'ang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag spro bar mdzad pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa mdzad do // rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ming yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa mdzad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis ni nyan thos kyi
translated: And to those who have not yet attained the acceptance that phenomena are not produced, the lord buddhas teach the doctrine by way of gladdening them and also utter cries of amazement.

original: sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa spangs pa yin te /
translated: “Subhūti, those bodhisattva great beings to whom the lord buddhas teach the doctrine by way of uttering their names and also utter cries of amazement, those bodhisattva great beings have abandoned the śrāvaka level and the pratyekabuddha level,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu'ang lung bstan pa yin /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu'ang lung bstan pa yin /
translated: and they have been prophesied to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa gang la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa gang la /
translated: “Subhūti, those bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ming yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa mdzad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni phyir mi ldog pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ming yongs su brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing ched du brjod pa'ang ched du brjod pa mdzad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni phyir mi ldog pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: The bodhisattva great beings who teach the Dharma by way of reciting the names of the lord buddhas and who also recite them will stand in irreversibility.

original: de la gnas pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gnas pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Standing in that, they will attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang @84b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo bshad pa thos na /🔽'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin no zhes nem nur med cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang @84b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo bshad pa thos na / 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin no zhes nem nur med cing /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings hear the explanation of the profound perfection of wisdom,

original: the tshom mi za la rmongs par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: the tshom mi za la rmongs par mi 'gyur na /
translated: they will not be doubtful, will not be uncertain, and will not be confused, thinking, ‘It is just as the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas have explained it.’🔽“Subhūti, if they do not doubt, are not uncertain, and are not confused,

original: des ni phyis kyang rgya cher de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu de dag las thos par 'gyur te /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la mos shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di de bzhin gshegs pas ji skad du bstan pa de bzhin du mos pas phyir mi ldog
analyzed: des ni phyis kyang rgya cher de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu de dag las thos par 'gyur te / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu de'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la mos shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di de bzhin gshegs pas ji skad du bstan pa de bzhin du mos pas phyir mi ldog
translated: In the future, too, they will hear from the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly awakened Buddha Akṣobhya and those sons of a good family in the Bodhisattva Vehicle.

original: pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: Those sons of a good family in the Bodhisattva Vehicle will have conviction in this perfection of wisdom, and by having conviction in this deep perfection of wisdom just as it has been taught by the Tathāgata, they will stand in irreversibility.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thos pa ni phan pa mang por 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thos pa ni phan pa mang por 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Subhūti, in that way, the bodhisattva great beings’ hearing this perfection of wisdom will be of much benefit.

original: gang gis thos shing mos nas de bzhin nyid du gnas pa dang / de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa de dag ni smos kyang mi smos te /
analyzed: gang gis thos shing mos nas de bzhin nyid du gnas pa dang / de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa de dag ni smos kyang mi smos te /
translated: Those who hear this, and who aspire to it, and who abide in suchness, and who practice in suchness, they are not even mentioned.

original: de dag de bzhin nyid la gnas /
analyzed: de dag de bzhin nyid la gnas /
translated: They abide in suchness.

original: de bzhin nyid la nan tan du byas nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la nan tan du byas nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having abided in suchness, and having practiced in suchness, they abide in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: de bzhin nyid du gnas nas de bzhin nyid du nan tan bgyis te chos gang yang ma dmigs na /🔽de ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen @85a *//
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du gnas nas de bzhin nyid du nan tan bgyis te chos gang yang ma dmigs na / de ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen @85a *//
translated: if, having abided in suchness, and having practiced in suchness, they do not apprehend any dharma at all,

original: pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur ba lags /
translated: how will they abide in the knowledge of all aspects?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: de ltar de bzhin nyid la ma gtogs pa'i chos kyang gang yang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin nyid la ma gtogs pa'i chos kyang gang yang mi dmigs na /
translated: if, apart from suchness, they do not apprehend any dharma at all,

original: su zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: su zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas par 'gyur /
translated: who will abide in suchness?

original: su zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: su zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur /
translated: Who would abide in suchness and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: su zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas shing chos ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: su zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas shing chos ston par 'gyur /
translated: Who would abide in suchness and teach the Dharma?

original: de bzhin nyid kyang dmigs sum mchis na /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyang dmigs sum mchis na /
translated: Since suchness is not apprehended,

original: de bzhin nyid la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin nyid la gnas te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / de bzhin nyid la gnas shing chos ston par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te de ni gnas ma mchis so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin nyid la gnas te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / de bzhin nyid la gnas shing chos ston par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te de ni gnas ma mchis so //
translated: how could there be someone who abides in suchness, or who abides in suchness and fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, or who abides in suchness and teaches the Dharma? That is not possible.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,🔽“Subhūti, it is so!

original: rab 'byor / gang khyod 'di skad du gang de bzhin nyid la gnas pa dang / de bzhin nyid la gnas te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / de bzhin nyid la gnas shing chos ston par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos gang yang de bzhin nyid la ma gtogs par gzhan dmigs su med de de bzhin nyid kyang dmigs su med na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang khyod 'di skad du gang de bzhin nyid la gnas pa dang / de bzhin nyid la gnas te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / de bzhin nyid la gnas shing chos ston par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos gang yang de bzhin nyid la ma gtogs par gzhan dmigs su med de de bzhin nyid kyang dmigs su med na /
translated: Subhūti, you have said, “Apart from suchness, no other dharma can be apprehended that would stand in suchness, or that would fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening standing in suchness, or that would teach the Dharma standing in suchness.

original: de bzhin nyid la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin nyid la gnas te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / de bzhin nyid la gnas shing chos @85b ston par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin nyid la gnas te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / de bzhin nyid la gnas shing chos @85b ston par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te /
translated: Since suchness itself cannot be apprehended, how could there be anyone who would stand in suchness, or who would fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening standing in suchness, or who would teach the Dharma standing in suchness?

original: de ni gnas med do zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: de ni gnas med do zhes zer ba ni /
translated: That is not possible.”

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: Subhūti, it is just as you have said.

original: de de bzhin te ji skad du smras pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: de de bzhin te ji skad du smras pa de bzhin no //
translated: It is just so, just as you have said.

original: rab 'byor / gang de bzhin nyid la gnas pa dang / gang de bzhin nyid la gnas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang de bzhin nyid la gnas pa dang / gang de bzhin nyid la gnas te /
translated: Subhūti, I do not see any dharma apart from suchness that would stand in suchness,🔽or that would stand in suchness and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, or that would stand in suchness and teach the Dharma.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / gang de bzhin nyid la gnas shing chos ston par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos gang yang de bzhin nyid la ma gtogs par gzhan yang dmigs su med de //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / gang de bzhin nyid la gnas shing chos ston par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos gang yang de bzhin nyid la ma gtogs par gzhan yang dmigs su med de //
translated: Suchness itself is not apprehended.

original: de bzhin nyid kyang dmigs su med na /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyang dmigs su med na /
translated: If suchness itself is not apprehended,

original: gang de bzhin nyid la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin nyid la gnas te /
analyzed: gang de bzhin nyid la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin nyid la gnas te /
translated: what dharma would stand in suchness,🔽or what dharma would stand in suchness and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, or what dharma would stand in suchness and teach the Dharma?

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / de bzhin nyid la gnas shing chos ston par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / de bzhin nyid la gnas shing chos ston par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te de ni gnas med do //
translated: That is not possible.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /🔽chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang; gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid de ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste / chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang; gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid de ni gnas pa'o //
translated: “Subhūti, whether the Tathāgatas arise or do not arise,🔽the suchness of dharmas, the unaltered suchness, the unmistaken suchness,🔽the true nature of dharmas, the dharma-constituent,

original: chos rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings dang / chos kyi gnas nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' de ni gnas pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings dang / chos kyi gnas nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' de ni gnas pa ste /
translated: the establishment of dharmas, the certification of dharmas, and the very limit of reality remain.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin nyid 'di la ni gang yang gnas par 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin nyid 'di la ni gang yang gnas par 'gyur ba med de /
translated: Subhūti, there is no one who stands in this suchness,

original: de la gnas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang @86a *//
analyzed: de la gnas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang @86a *//
translated: and there is no one who, standing in it, fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rgya bar 'gyur ba su'ang med na /
analyzed: rgya bar 'gyur ba su'ang med na /
translated: If there is no one who stands in it,🔽then how could there be anyone who, standing in it, teaches the Dharma?
