That is not possible.”🔽“Subhūti, it is because bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom do not stand in form,🔽do not stand in feeling,🔽do not stand in perception,🔽do not stand in volitional factors,🔽and do not stand in consciousness.🔽“Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom do not stand in the eyes,🔽do not stand in the ears,🔽do not stand in the nose,🔽do not stand in the tongue,🔽do not stand in the body,🔽and do not stand in the thinking mind.🔽“Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom do not stand in a form,🔽do not stand in a sound,🔽do not stand in a smell,🔽do not stand in a taste,🔽do not stand in a feeling,

original: de la gnas shing chos ston par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: de la gnas shing chos ston par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te de ni gnas med do //
translated: and do not stand in a dharma.🔽“Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom do not stand in the eye constituent,🔽do not stand in the form constituent,🔽do not stand in the eye consciousness constituent,🔽do not stand in the ear constituent,🔽do not stand in the sound constituent,🔽do not stand in the ear consciousness constituent,🔽do not stand in the nose constituent,🔽do not stand in the smell constituent,🔽do not stand in the nose consciousness constituent,🔽do not stand in the tongue constituent,🔽do not stand in the taste constituent,🔽do not stand in the tongue consciousness constituent,🔽do not stand in the body constituent,🔽do not stand in the feeling constituent,🔽do not stand in the body consciousness constituent,🔽do not stand in the thinking-mind constituent,🔽do not stand in the dharma constituent,

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zab pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zab pa ste /
translated: this perfection of wisdom is deep.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'tshal ba de dag ni dka' ba bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'tshal ba de dag ni dka' ba bgyid pa'o //
translated: those bodhisattva great beings who want to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening do the difficult thing.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: chos gang yang dmigs su ma mchis te /
analyzed: chos gang yang dmigs su ma mchis te /
translated: no dharma at all is apprehended.

original: su'ang de bzhin nyid la gnas pa ma mchis la /
analyzed: su'ang de bzhin nyid la gnas pa ma mchis la /
translated: No one stands in suchness,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'ang gang yang ma mchis te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'ang gang yang ma mchis te /
translated: and no one at all fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: chos ston pa'ang gang yang ma mchis la des zhum par yang mi 'gyur zhing de dag la nem nur du 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: chos ston pa'ang gang yang ma mchis la des zhum par yang mi 'gyur zhing de dag la nem nur du 'gyur ba'am /
translated: No dharma at all is taught, and they do not become fainthearted about that, and they do not become doubtful about that,

original: rmongs par 'gyur ba ma mchis pa ni dka' ba bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: rmongs par 'gyur ba ma mchis pa ni dka' ba bgyid pa'o //
translated: Not to be confused or bewildered is difficult to do.

original: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Then the elder Subhūti

original: lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said this to Śatakratu, head of the gods:

original: koo shi ka //
analyzed: koo shi ka //
translated: “Kauśika,

original: gang khyod kyis 'di skad du /
analyzed: gang khyod kyis 'di skad du /
translated: you have said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang chos zab mo 'di dag la nem nur du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang chos zab mo 'di dag la nem nur du mi 'gyur /
translated: ‘Blessed One,

original: rmongs par mi 'gyur ba ni dka' ba bgyid pa'o zhes gsol ba ni /
analyzed: rmongs par mi 'gyur ba ni dka' ba bgyid pa'o zhes gsol ba ni /
translated: it is difficult for bodhisattva great beings not to be doubtful or bewildered about these deep dharmas.’

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin na /🔽de la @86b nem nur du 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin na / de la @86b nem nur du 'gyur ba'am /
translated: all dharmas are emptiness.

original: rmongs par 'gyur ba lta su zhig yod /
analyzed: rmongs par 'gyur ba lta su zhig yod /
translated: So what is there to be doubtful or bewildered about?

original: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
translated: Śatakratu said,

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor ni gang ci ston kyang de thams cad stong pa nyid brtsams shing ston te /
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor ni gang ci ston kyang de thams cad stong pa nyid brtsams shing ston te /
translated: “The elder Subhūti teaches whatever he teaches, and he teaches it all based on emptiness.

original: ci la'ang chags pa med do //
analyzed: ci la'ang chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to anything.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / bar snang la 'phangs pa'i mda' ni ci la'ang chags pa med do //🔽de bzhin du gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis chos bstan par yang ci la'ang chags pa med do //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
analyzed: dper na / bar snang la 'phangs pa'i mda' ni ci la'ang chags pa med do // de bzhin du gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis chos bstan par yang ci la'ang chags pa med do // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
translated: For example, an arrow shot into the air does not stick to anything.🔽In the same way, the teaching of the Dharma by the elder Subhūti does not stick to anything.🔽From the Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines🔽

original: le'u bzhi bcu dgu'o ////🔽de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽bcom ldan 'das /🔽ci lags / bdag gis de skad du gsol te /🔽de skad du brjod pas /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i rjes su brjod pa dang / chos su brjod cing chos su gnyer ba'i chos nyid yang dag par lung bstan pas lung bstan par 'gyur ba lags sam /
analyzed: le'u bzhi bcu dgu'o //// de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to // bcom ldan 'das / ci lags / bdag gis de skad du gsol te / de skad du brjod pas / bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i rjes su brjod pa dang / chos su brjod cing chos su gnyer ba'i chos nyid yang dag par lung bstan pas lung bstan par 'gyur ba lags sam /
translated: For example, an arrow shot into the air does not stick to anything.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽koo shi ka /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽koo shi ka /
translated: In the same way, the teaching of the Dharma by the elder Subhūti does not stick to anything.

original: gang khyod kyis de skad du smras te de skad du brjod pas de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i rjes su brjod pa dang / chos su brjod cing chos kyis gnyer ba'i chos nyid lung bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang khyod kyis de skad du smras te de skad du brjod pas de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i rjes su brjod pa dang / chos su brjod cing chos kyis gnyer ba'i chos nyid lung bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: You have spoken thus, and by speaking thus you have repeated what the Tathagata has said, and you have taught the Dharma, and you have been inspired by the Dharma, and you have been consecrated in the Dharma.🔽Śakra said:

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor 'dis ci dang ci spobs pa de thams cad stong pa nyid brtsams shing spobs /
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor 'dis ci dang ci spobs pa de thams cad stong pa nyid brtsams shing spobs /
translated: whatever the elder Subhūti has expounded with such eloquence, he has expounded it with reference to emptiness.

original: mtshan ma ma mchis pa nyid brtsams shing spobs /🔽smon pa ma @87a *//
analyzed: mtshan ma ma mchis pa nyid brtsams shing spobs / smon pa ma @87a *//
translated: He has expounded it with reference to the absence of attributes.🔽He has expounded it with reference to the absence of expectancy.

original: mchis pa nyid brtsams shing spobs pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid brtsams shing spobs /
analyzed: mchis pa nyid brtsams shing spobs pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid brtsams shing spobs /
translated: He has expounded it with reference to the perfection of giving.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid brtsams shing spobs pa dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid brtsams shing spobs pa dang /
translated: the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom;

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du brtsams shing spobs pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams brtsams shing spobs pa dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du brtsams shing spobs pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams brtsams shing spobs pa dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang /
translated: the emptiness of internal phenomena, up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities; the applications of mindfulness; the right efforts; the legs of miraculous power;

original: dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa brtsams shing spobs pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams brtsams shing spobs pa dang /
analyzed: dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa brtsams shing spobs pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams brtsams shing spobs pa dang /
translated: eloquence in the composition of the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path;🔽eloquence in the composition of the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, and the formless absorptions;

original: rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams brtsams shing spobs pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams brtsams shing spobs pa dang /
translated: eloquence in the composition of the liberations, the serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the higher knowledges, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways;

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos @87b ma 'dres pa rnams brtsams shing spobs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du brtsams shing spobs pa ni ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos @87b ma 'dres pa rnams brtsams shing spobs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du brtsams shing spobs pa ni ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: “It is amazing that you have begun to speak with eloquence about the tathāgatas’ powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and that you have begun to speak with eloquence about , up to and including omniscience.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: “Kauśika,

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor stong pa nyid la rnam par spyod pas /🔽sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor stong pa nyid la rnam par spyod pas / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: the elder Subhūti, who has practiced the emptiness,🔽does not apprehend even the perfection of giving,

original: gang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lta ci smos /
translated: let alone someone who practices the perfection of giving.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom itself are non-apprehensible,

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lta ci smos /
translated: how much more so someone practicing the perfection of wisdom!

original: nang stong pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: “The emptiness of internal phenomena is non-apprehensible,

original: gang nang stong pa nyid la bsgom pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang nang stong pa nyid la bsgom pa lta ci smos /
translated: how much more so someone meditating on the emptiness of internal phenomena!

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi par yang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi par yang mi dmigs na /
translated: Up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is non-apprehensible,

original: gang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la bsgom pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la bsgom pa lta ci smos /
translated: how much more so someone meditating on the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature!

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: The applications of mindfulness are non-apprehensible,

original: gang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la bsgom pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la bsgom pa lta ci smos /
translated: how much more so someone meditating on the applications of mindfulness!

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'ang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'ang mi dmigs na /
translated: and the noble eightfold path are non-apprehensible,

original: gang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa lta ci smos /
translated: how much more so someone practicing the noble eightfold path!🔽The noble truths,🔽the concentrations,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med @88a *//
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med @88a *//
translated: the immeasurables,

original: med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: and the formless absorptions are non-apprehensible,

original: gang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la bsgom ba pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la bsgom ba pa lta ci smos /
translated: how much more so someone cultivating the formless absorptions!

original: rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyi gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyi gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: the gateways of mnemonic incantation, the gateways of meditative absorption, the dhāraṇī seal, the emptiness, the signless, the undirected, the unproduced, the absence of attributes, and the realization of the transcendent perfection of wisdom are non-apprehensible,

original: gang gzungs kyi sgo rnams la bsgom pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang gzungs kyi sgo rnams la bsgom pa lta ci smos /
translated: how could the meditative development of the dhāraṇī gateways possibly be apprehended?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: The ten powers of the tathāgatas are non-apprehensible,

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams mngon par bsgrub pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams mngon par bsgrub pa lta ci smos /
translated: how could the attainment of the ten powers of the tathāgatas possibly be apprehended?

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: The four assurances are non-apprehensible,

original: gang mi 'jigs pa rnams mngon par bsgrub pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang mi 'jigs pa rnams mngon par bsgrub pa lta ci smos /
translated: how could the attainment of the four assurances possibly be apprehended?

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: The four kinds of exact knowledge are non-apprehensible,

original: gang so so yang dag par rig pa rnams mngon par bsgrub pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang so so yang dag par rig pa rnams mngon par bsgrub pa lta ci smos /
translated: how could the attainment of the four kinds of exact knowledge possibly be apprehended?

original: snying rje chen po nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: snying rje chen po nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: Great compassion is non-apprehensible,

original: gang snying rje chen po la rnam par spyod pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang snying rje chen po la rnam par spyod pa lta ci smos /
translated: how much more so for those who practice great compassion!

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: “The buddhadharmas are not apprehended,🔽how much more so for those who accomplish the buddhadharmas!

original: gang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams mngon par bsgrub pa lta ci smos; byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams mngon par bsgrub pa lta ci smos; byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: The branches of enlightenment are not apprehended,

original: gang byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba ci smos /
analyzed: gang byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba ci smos /
translated: how much more so for those who fully awaken to enlightenment!

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: Omniscience is not apprehended,

original: gang rnam pa thams cad @88b mkhyen pa nyid rjes su 'thob pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang rnam pa thams cad @88b mkhyen pa nyid rjes su 'thob pa lta ci smos /
translated: how much more so for those who attain omniscience!

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: The Tathāgata is not apprehended,

original: gang de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ba lta ci smos /
translated: how much more so for those who will become tathāgatas!

original: ma skyes pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: ma skyes pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: Nonarising is not apprehended,

original: gang ma skyes pa mngon par 'du byed pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang ma skyes pa mngon par 'du byed pa lta ci smos /
translated: how much more so for those who create nonarising!

original: mtshan rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: mtshan rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: The marks are not apprehended,

original: gang gi lus la mtshan yod par 'gyur ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang gi lus la mtshan yod par 'gyur ba lta ci smos /
translated: how much more so for those whose bodies will have the marks!

original: dpe byad rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: dpe byad rnams kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: If the major marks are not apprehended,

original: gang gi lus la dpe byad yod par 'gyur ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang gi lus la dpe byad yod par 'gyur ba lta ci smos /
translated: what need is there to speak of the body on which the major marks would be based?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor ni chos thams cad dben pa la rnam par spyod pa ste /
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor ni chos thams cad dben pa la rnam par spyod pa ste /
translated: the elder Subhūti is engaged with all phenomena being void,

original: dmigs su med pa la rnam par spyod pa /
analyzed: dmigs su med pa la rnam par spyod pa /
translated: he is engaged with the unapprehendable,

original: stong pa nyid la rnam par spyod pa /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la rnam par spyod pa /
translated: he is engaged with emptiness,

original: mtshan ma med pa la rnam par spyod pa /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la rnam par spyod pa /
translated: he is engaged with signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa la rnam par spyod pa ste /
analyzed: smon pa med pa la rnam par spyod pa ste /
translated: and he is engaged with wishlessness.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi rnam par spyod pa gang yin pa des ni /
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi rnam par spyod pa gang yin pa des ni /
translated: the engagement of the elder Subhūti

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par spyod pa'i rnam par spyod pa la brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par spyod pa'i rnam par spyod pa la brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro /
translated: does not approach even a hundredth part of the engagement of bodhisattva great beings in the perfection of wisdom, and the engagement of bodhisattva great beings in the perfection of wisdom does not approach even a thousandth part of the engagement of the elder Subhūti.

original: stong gi cha dang / brgya phrag stong gi cha dang / bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi bar gyi char yang nye bar mi 'gro /
analyzed: stong gi cha dang / brgya phrag stong gi cha dang / bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi bar gyi char yang nye bar mi 'gro /
translated: It does not approach even a thousandth part, or a hundred thousandth part, or a one hundred thousandth of a one hundred thousandth part of that.

original: grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang / rgyur yang mi bzod do //
analyzed: grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang / rgyur yang mi bzod do //
translated: It is not even a fraction, or a comparison, or a simile, or a resemblance.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par spyod pa'i rnam par spyod pa ma gtogs par byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @89a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par spyod pa'i rnam par spyod pa ma gtogs par byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @89a *//
translated: Except for the Tathagata’s way of life, no one else has a way of life like that of the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of wisdom.

original: pa la spyod ba'i rnam par spyod pa gang yin pa dang / nyan thos rnams kyi rnam par spyod pa gang yin pa dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par spyod pa gang yin pa'i rnam par spyod pa de dag las byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i rnam par spyod pa 'di nyid mchog ces bya'o //🔽rab ces bya'o //🔽phul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa la spyod ba'i rnam par spyod pa gang yin pa dang / nyan thos rnams kyi rnam par spyod pa gang yin pa dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par spyod pa gang yin pa'i rnam par spyod pa de dag las byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i rnam par spyod pa 'di nyid mchog ces bya'o // rab ces bya'o // phul zhes bya'o //
translated: “The bodhisattva great beings’ practice of the perfection of wisdom is said to be the best of all practices,🔽the most excellent,

original: dam pa zhes bya'o //🔽gya nom pa zhes bya'o //🔽bla na med pa /
analyzed: dam pa zhes bya'o // gya nom pa zhes bya'o // bla na med pa /
translated: the highest,🔽the most sublime,🔽the unexcelled,

original: gong na med pa /
analyzed: gong na med pa /
translated: the unsurpassed,

original: mnyam pa med pa /
analyzed: mnyam pa med pa /
translated: the unequaled,

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and the equal of the unequaled.

original: koo shi ka /🔽de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: koo shi ka / de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur bar 'dod pas /
translated: Kauśika,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: therefore, if bodhisattva great beings want to be the best of all beings,🔽they should train in this perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par spyod pa 'di nyid kyis rnam par spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par spyod pa 'di nyid kyis rnam par spyad par bya'o //
translated: “You should practice this very perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das te /
translated: a bodhisattva great being practicing this perfection of wisdom goes beyond the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug go /
translated: and enters into the certainty of bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs nas /
translated: Having entered into the certainty of bodhisattvas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: he will complete the buddhadharmas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes rjes su 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas nas / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes rjes su 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having completed the buddhadharmas,🔽he will attain the knowledge of a knower of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes @89b rjes su thob nas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes @89b rjes su thob nas /
translated: Having attained the knowledge of a knower of all aspects,

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
translated: They will become thus-gone ones, worthy ones, perfect buddhas who have abandoned all afflictions and the latent tendencies.

original: de nas 'khor de'i nang nas sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams me tog manda ra ba mang po thogs te /
analyzed: de nas 'khor de'i nang nas sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams me tog manda ra ba mang po thogs te /
translated: Then, from within the assembly, the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three took up many mandārava flowers

original: bcom ldan 'das la gtor to //🔽mngon par gtor to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la gtor to // mngon par gtor to //
translated: and scattered them over the Blessed One.🔽They scattered them over him again and again.

original: rab tu gtor to //
analyzed: rab tu gtor to //
translated: They scattered them all over him.

original: dge slong brgya drug cu tsam yang stan las langs nas /
analyzed: dge slong brgya drug cu tsam yang stan las langs nas /
translated: Some sixty-six monks also rose from their seats,

original: chos gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar te /
analyzed: chos gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar te /
translated: put their upper robes over one shoulder,

original: pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs nas /🔽bcom ldan 'das gang na ba de logs su thal mo sbyar bas btud nas /
analyzed: pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs nas / bcom ldan 'das gang na ba de logs su thal mo sbyar bas btud nas /
translated: and knelt on their right knees.🔽They bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined

original: bcom ldan 'das la mig mi 'dzum par lta zhing phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la mig mi 'dzum par lta zhing phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: and paid homage to him with unblinking eyes.

original: dge slong de dag gis thal mo sbyar te btud pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dge slong de dag gis thal mo sbyar te btud pa'i tshe /
translated: When those monks bowed with palms joined,

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthus snyim pa me tog manda ra bas gang bar gyur nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthus snyim pa me tog manda ra bas gang bar gyur nas /
translated: through the Buddha’s power their cupped hands became filled with mandārava flowers.

original: me tog manda ra ba de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la gtor to //🔽mngon par gtor to //
analyzed: me tog manda ra ba de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la gtor to // mngon par gtor to //
translated: They scattered the mandārava flowers over the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.🔽They scattered them well.

original: rab tu gtor to //
analyzed: rab tu gtor to //
translated: They scattered them thoroughly.

original: de ltar 'thor zhing mngon par 'thor ba dang / rab tu 'thor ba de'i tshe tshig 'di skad ces brjod de /
analyzed: de ltar 'thor zhing mngon par 'thor ba dang / rab tu 'thor ba de'i tshe tshig 'di skad ces brjod de /
translated: While they were scattering, scattering well, and scattering thoroughly, they said this:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyod yul ma lags pa'i rnam par spyod pa dam pas /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyod yul ma lags pa'i rnam par spyod pa dam pas /
translated: through these roots of merit, may we practice the highest practice, which is not the domain of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.”

original: bdag cag rnam par spyod par gyur cig ces smras pa dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi dge slong de dag gi bsam pa thugs su chud de /
analyzed: bdag cag rnam par spyod par gyur cig ces smras pa dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi dge slong de dag gi bsam pa thugs su chud de /
translated: Then the Bhagavān, knowing the thoughts that were in the minds of those bhikṣus,

original: de'i tshe 'dzum pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dzum pa mdzad do //
translated: at that time smiled.

original: sangs @90a *// rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos nyid kyis kyang de ste /
analyzed: sangs @90a *// rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos nyid kyis kyang de ste /
translated: It is the nature of the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas that

original: de ltar 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i tshe /
translated: when they smile,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi sgo nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi sgo nas /
translated: from the mouth of the Bhagavān

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: these kinds of light rays issue forth:

original: 'od zer sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / le brgan dang / shel dang dngul gyi kha dog lta bu rnam pa sna tshogs byung ste /
analyzed: 'od zer sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / le brgan dang / shel dang dngul gyi kha dog lta bu rnam pa sna tshogs byung ste /
translated: blue, yellow, red, white, purple, crystal, and silver-colored light rays.

original: de dag gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bas rgyas par bkang nas phyir 'dus te /
analyzed: de dag gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bas rgyas par bkang nas phyir 'dus te /
translated: They filled the trichiliocosm with light, and then returned.

original: bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum du g-yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum du g-yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas /
translated: They circled the Bhagavān three times to the right🔽and disappeared into the crown of his head.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi dbu'i gtsug tu nub bo; ;de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo stan las langs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi dbu'i gtsug tu nub bo; ;de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo stan las langs nas /
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda rose from his seat,

original: bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas te /🔽pus mo g-yas pa'i lhang ngas la btsugs nas /
analyzed: bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas te / pus mo g-yas pa'i lhang ngas la btsugs nas /
translated: put his upper robe over one shoulder,🔽and knelt on his right knee.

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar bas btud de /🔽bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar bas btud de / bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: He bowed to the Bhagavān with palms joined🔽and asked the Bhagavān,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen ma mchis par 'dzum pa mi mdzad na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen ma mchis par 'dzum pa mi mdzad na /
translated: “Tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas do not smile for no reason.

original: ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis 'dzum pa mdzad /
analyzed: ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis 'dzum pa mdzad /
translated: What is the cause, what is the reason for your smile?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One said to the venerable Nanda,

original: dga' bo / dge slong brgya drug cu po 'di dag bskal pa dpe skar ma lta bu la /
analyzed: dga' bo / dge slong brgya drug cu po 'di dag bskal pa dpe skar ma lta bu la /
translated: “Nanda, these one hundred and sixty monks, in the eon called Tārāsaṃpṛkṣā,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang @90b rgya ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang @90b rgya ste /
translated: will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: me tog sil ma zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sha stag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me tog sil ma zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sha stag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will appear in the world as tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas called Puṣpamātra.

original: dga' bo / me tog sil ma zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gi dge slong gi dge 'dun mtshungs par 'gyur /
analyzed: dga' bo / me tog sil ma zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gi dge slong gi dge 'dun mtshungs par 'gyur /
translated: Nanda, the saṅgha of bhikṣus of those tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas will be the same,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing mtshungs par 'gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing mtshungs par 'gyur /
translated: their buddha realms will be the same,

original: tshe'i tshad kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshe'i tshad kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: and their lifespans will be the same,

original: lo stong du mtshungs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lo stong du mtshungs par 'gyur te /
translated: namely, one thousand years.

original: de dag gang dang gang nas mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / mngon par byung nas rab tu 'byung ba dang / rab tu byung nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba de dang de dag tu me tog kha dog rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'i me tog gi char mngon par 'bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gang dang gang nas mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / mngon par byung nas rab tu 'byung ba dang / rab tu byung nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba de dang de dag tu me tog kha dog rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'i me tog gi char mngon par 'bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: Wherever they appear, having appeared, go forth, having gone forth, and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, a rain of flowers with five different colors will fall there.

original: dga' bo / de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par spyod pa'i dam pas rnam par spyod par 'dod pas /
analyzed: dga' bo / de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par spyod pa'i dam pas rnam par spyod par 'dod pas /
translated: Therefore, Nanda, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to practice the supreme practice

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyad par bya'o //
translated: should practice this perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par spyod pas rnam par spyod par 'dod pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par spyod pas rnam par spyod par 'dod pas /
translated: A bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to practice the practice of the Tathāgata

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: should practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: dga' bo; ;rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: dga' bo; ;rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Nanda, a son or daughter of good family

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo des 'di ltar bdag ni mi'i nang nas shi 'phos @91a *//
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo des 'di ltar bdag ni mi'i nang nas shi 'phos @91a *//
translated: who practices this profound perfection of wisdom should think like this: ‘I have died among humans

original: nas 'dir skyes pa'am /
analyzed: nas 'dir skyes pa'am /
translated: and been reborn here,

original: dga' ldan gyi lha'i ris nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa ste /
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi lha'i ris nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa ste /
translated: or I have died among the Tuṣita devas and been reborn here.

original: mi'i nang du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di rgya cher thos pa'am /
analyzed: mi'i nang du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di rgya cher thos pa'am /
translated: Among humans I have extensively heard this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: dga' ldan gyi lha'i ris su shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di rgya cher thos pa'o zhes bya bar rtogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi lha'i ris su shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di rgya cher thos pa'o zhes bya bar rtogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that they have heard this profound perfection of wisdom extensively in the god realm of Tuṣita.

original: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de dag de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par gzigs par blta ste /
analyzed: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de dag de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par gzigs par blta ste /
translated: Nanda, one should see that the tathāgatas look upon those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyan pa dang / thos nas 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang /
analyzed: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyan pa dang / thos nas 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang /
translated: Nanda, if any son or daughter of good family listens to this profound perfection of wisdom, and having heard it, takes it up, bears it in mind, reads it aloud, masters it,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang; gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston cing rjes su 'doms pa'i gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa des bdag gis de bzhin gshegs
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang; gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston cing rjes su 'doms pa'i gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa des bdag gis de bzhin gshegs
translated: “Ānanda, it should be known that those individuals who teach this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom to bodhisattvas and instruct them in it, and those individuals who are bodhisattvas and who properly pay attention to this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom, should understand that they have heard this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom

original: pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams las /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos par gyur /
analyzed: pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams las / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos par gyur /
translated: from the tathāgatas, arhats, and perfectly awakened buddhas,🔽that they have received it,

original: bzung ba dang / bcangs pa dang / bklags pa dang / kun chub par byas par gyur te /
analyzed: bzung ba dang / bcangs pa dang / bklags pa dang / kun chub par byas par gyur te /
translated: that they have held it, read it, and mastered it,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag la'ang dge ba'i rtsa ba mang @91b bo bskyed par gyur to zhes bya bar rtogs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag la'ang dge ba'i rtsa ba mang @91b bo bskyed par gyur to zhes bya bar rtogs par rig par bya ste /
translated: and that they have also generated many roots of virtue in the presence of those tathāgatas, arhats, and perfectly awakened buddhas.

original: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Ānanda, it should be known that those sons of enlightened heritage or

original: rigs kyi bu mo des bdag gis ni nyan thos rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo des bdag gis ni nyan thos rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed /
translated: “Ānanda, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family should know that they have not planted wholesome roots with the śrāvakas,

original: nyan thos rnams las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //🔽dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o // dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: and that they have not heard this deep perfection of wisdom from the śrāvakas.”

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / don dang / chos dang / yi ge dang mthun par khong du chud par byed na /🔽dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / don dang / chos dang / yi ge dang mthun par khong du chud par byed na / dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Ānanda, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who takes up, bears in mind, reads aloud, masters, and understands this deep perfection of wisdom in the right way, in accordance with the meaning, the teaching, the letters, and the order of the letters,

original: rigs kyi bu mo des bdag la ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mngon du gyur to zhes bya bar rtogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo des bdag la ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mngon du gyur to zhes bya bar rtogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Ānanda, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family should know that they have seen the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha.”

original: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan pa thos na /
analyzed: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan pa thos na /
translated: Ananda, if a son or daughter of good family, on hearing this teaching of the profound perfection of wisdom,

original: phyir mi zlog cing ngan du mi brjod la thos nas kyang mos pa thob par 'gyur na /
analyzed: phyir mi zlog cing ngan du mi brjod la thos nas kyang mos pa thob par 'gyur na /
translated: does not turn back, does not speak ill of it, and on hearing it attains faith,

original: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Ananda, that son or daughter of good family

original: rigs kyi bu mo de ni sngon gyi rgyal ba la bya ba byas pa /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de ni sngon gyi rgyal ba la bya ba byas pa /
translated: should be known as one who has served the victors of the past,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa /
translated: one who has planted roots of virtue,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: and one who has been taken up by a spiritual friend.

original: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am; rigs kyi bu mo gang la las de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa lta'ang mi bslu ste /🔽nyan thos sam /🔽@92a *// rang sangs rgyas sam /
analyzed: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am; rigs kyi bu mo gang la las de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa lta'ang mi bslu ste / nyan thos sam / @92a *// rang sangs rgyas sam /
translated: Ananda, a son or daughter of good family who has planted roots of virtue with the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones, will not be deceived.🔽Whether they become a shravaka,🔽a pratyekabuddha,

original: sangs rgyas su 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas su 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: or a buddha,

original: 'on kyang / dga' bo /
analyzed: 'on kyang / dga' bo /
translated: Ananda,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po /
translated: a bodhisattva mahasattva

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang /
translated: “They are those who practice the perfection of generosity, the perfection of conduct, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang; bsam gtan rnams dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang; bsam gtan rnams dang /
translated: the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of insight; those who practice the emptinesses, the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, the noble truths, the concentrations,

original: tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang /
analyzed: tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang /
translated: the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness;

original: mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod pa dang /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pas ni shin tu rtog par bya ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pas ni shin tu rtog par bya ste /
translated: and the ten powers of the tathāgatas, and the four fearlessnesses, and the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: shin tu rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul @92b khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: shin tu rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul @92b khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: and up to the knowledge of all aspects, and they should also thoroughly understand the perfection of giving, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa dang /
translated: the perfection of meditative stability, the perfection of wisdom, inner emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la spyod pa dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang; rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa dang /🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la spyod pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa ni nyan thos sam /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la spyod pa dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang; rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la spyod pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa ni nyan thos sam /
translated: the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of awakening, and the path,

original: rang sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: up to the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, and up to the knowledge of all aspects, they will not become śrāvakas or pratyekabuddhas.

original: dga' bo / de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di khyod la gtad de /
analyzed: dga' bo / de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di khyod la gtad de /
translated: Therefore, Nanda, I entrust this profound perfection of wisdom to you.

original: dga' bo / gal te khyod kyis ngas chos gang ji snyed cig bshad pa las /
analyzed: dga' bo / gal te khyod kyis ngas chos gang ji snyed cig bshad pa las /
translated: Nanda, if you were to retain all the teachings I have given,🔽except for the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma gtogs par ngas chos bstan pa de dag thams cad bzung ste /🔽kun chub par byas nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma gtogs par ngas chos bstan pa de dag thams cad bzung ste / kun chub par byas nas /
translated: and master them,

original: de'i 'og tu chud gsan te bor yang de tsam gyis /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu chud gsan te bor yang de tsam gyis /
translated: and then forget them and abandon them afterwards,

original: dga' bo khyod la skyon du ngas mi brtsi'i /
analyzed: dga' bo khyod la skyon du ngas mi brtsi'i /
translated: I would not consider that a fault on your part, Nanda.

original: dga' bo / gal te khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bzung ste /🔽kun chub par byas nas de'i 'og tu chud gsan tam /
analyzed: dga' bo / gal te khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bzung ste / kun chub par byas nas de'i 'og tu chud gsan tam /
translated: Nanda, if you were to retain this profound perfection of wisdom,🔽and master it, and then forget it

original: bor bar gyur na des ni /
analyzed: bor bar gyur na des ni /
translated: or abandon it afterwards,

original: dga' bo khyod la ngas skyon du gzung ngo //
analyzed: dga' bo khyod la ngas skyon du gzung ngo //
translated: that would be considered a fault on your part, Nanda.

original: dga' bo / @93a *//
analyzed: dga' bo / @93a *//
translated: Nanda,

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: therefore,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di khyod la gtad kyi //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di khyod la gtad kyi //
translated: I entrust this profound perfection of wisdom to you.

original: ci nas kyang gzung ba dang / bcang ba dang / bklag pa dang / kun chub par bya ba dang / shin tu yid la gzung bar gyis shig /
analyzed: ci nas kyang gzung ba dang / bcang ba dang / bklag pa dang / kun chub par bya ba dang / shin tu yid la gzung bar gyis shig /
translated: You should by all means uphold, keep, read, master, and fully retain it.

original: legs par yongs su zin pa dang / legs par kun chub pa dang / legs par bcang bar gyis shig /
analyzed: legs par yongs su zin pa dang / legs par kun chub pa dang / legs par bcang bar gyis shig /
translated: You should fully grasp it, fully understand it, and fully keep it.

original: yi ge dang / tshig dang / 'bru shin tu rdzogs pa dang / nges pa'i tshig shin tu legs par zin par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge dang / tshig dang / 'bru shin tu rdzogs pa dang / nges pa'i tshig shin tu legs par zin par bya'o //
translated: You should fully perfect the letters, words, and syllables, and fully grasp the etymological definitions.

original: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am /🔽rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang; klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa des ni /
analyzed: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am / rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang; klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa des ni /
translated: Nanda, any son or daughter of good family who upholds,

original: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi byang chub bzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi byang chub bzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: keeps, reads, and masters this profound perfection of wisdom will uphold the awakening of the blessed buddhas of the past, future, and present.

original: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Nanda, any son or daughter of good family

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa des ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa des ni /
translated: Any son or daughter of good family who takes up this profound perfection of wisdom

original: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi byang chub mthun par yongs su bzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi byang chub mthun par yongs su bzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: will have taken up the enlightenment of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, of the past, future, and present.

original: dga' bo mngon du gyur par nga la gang me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan gyis rim gror bya ba dang / bkur stir bya ba dang /
analyzed: dga' bo mngon du gyur par nga la gang me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan gyis rim gror bya ba dang / bkur stir bya ba dang /
translated: “Ānanda, anyone who wishes to honor me with flowers, garlands, perfume, ointments, aromatic powders, clothing, parasols, victory banners, and flags,

original: bsti stang du bya ba dang / mchod par bya bar 'dod pa des /
analyzed: bsti stang du bya ba dang / mchod par bya bar 'dod pa des /
translated: and to venerate, respect, and worship me🔽with the five perfections,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo @93b 'di gzung bar bya /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo @93b 'di gzung bar bya /
translated: should take up this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: bcang bar bya /
analyzed: bcang bar bya /
translated: carry it,

original: bklag par bya /
analyzed: bklag par bya /
translated: read it,

original: kun chub par bya'o //
analyzed: kun chub par bya'o //
translated: and master it.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin zab mo 'di bzung ste /🔽bcangs nas bklags shing /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin zab mo 'di bzung ste / bcangs nas bklags shing /
translated: Having taken up this profound perfection of wisdom,🔽carried it, read it,

original: kun chub par bya ste /
analyzed: kun chub par bya ste /
translated: and mastered it,

original: me tog dang; phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan gyis rim gror bya /🔽bkur stir bya /
analyzed: me tog dang; phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan gyis rim gror bya / bkur stir bya /
translated: and with flowers, garlands, perfume, ointments, aromatic powders, clothing, parasols, flags, and banners.🔽They should honor it,

original: bsti stang du bya /
analyzed: bsti stang du bya /
translated: they should revere it,

original: mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod par bya'o //
translated: they should worship it.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rim gro dang / bkur sti dang / bsti stang dang / mchod pa byas na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rim gro dang / bkur sti dang / bsti stang dang / mchod pa byas na /
translated: If you honor, revere, respect, and worship the perfection of wisdom,

original: des ni nga'ang mchod par 'gyur /
analyzed: des ni nga'ang mchod par 'gyur /
translated: you will also honor me.

original: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang mchod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang mchod par 'gyur ro //
translated: You will honor the past, future, and present Buddhas.

original: dga' bo / gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan pa la rim gro dang / dga' ba dang / mos pa bskyed pa des ni /
analyzed: dga' bo / gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan pa la rim gro dang / dga' ba dang / mos pa bskyed pa des ni /
translated: Whoever, Nanda, generates respect, joy, and confidence in this teaching of the profound perfection of wisdom,

original: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la rim gro dang / dga' ba dang / mos pa bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la rim gro dang / dga' ba dang / mos pa bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will serve, love, and respect the Blessed Buddhas of the past, present, and future.

original: dga' bo / gal te khyod la nga sdug cing yid du 'ong bas yongs su ma btang zhe na /
analyzed: dga' bo / gal te khyod la nga sdug cing yid du 'ong bas yongs su ma btang zhe na /
translated: “ Nanda, if you love me and do not want to abandon me,

original: dga' bo / khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di sdug pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / yongs su mi gtong ba gyis shig /
analyzed: dga' bo / khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di sdug pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / yongs su mi gtong ba gyis shig /
translated: Nanda, you should love, cherish, and not abandon this perfection of wisdom.

original: ci nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di las tshig 'ga' yang khyod kyis chud ma zos par gyis shig /
analyzed: ci nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di las tshig 'ga' yang khyod kyis chud ma zos par gyis shig /
translated: Do not let a single word of this deep perfection of wisdom be lost to you.

original: dga' bo / ngas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di gtad par brtsams /
analyzed: dga' bo / ngas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di gtad par brtsams /
translated: “ Nanda, I have begun to entrust this deep perfection of wisdom to you,

original: @94a *// te; khyod la shin tu mang du bstan pa'ang mdor na /
analyzed: @94a *// te; khyod la shin tu mang du bstan pa'ang mdor na /
translated: and I have taught it to you in great detail, but in brief

original: dga' bo / khyod la nga ji ltar ston par gyur pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'ang khyod kyi ston pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dga' bo / khyod la nga ji ltar ston par gyur pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'ang khyod kyi ston pa yin gyi /
translated: Nanda, just as you know me to be your teacher, so you should know this perfection of wisdom to be your teacher.

original: dga' bo / de bas na ngas khyod la tshad med par gtad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di yongs su gtad de /
analyzed: dga' bo / de bas na ngas khyod la tshad med par gtad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di yongs su gtad de /
translated: Nanda, therefore, I entrust this profound perfection of wisdom to you without limit.

original: dga' bo / de bas na lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi mdun du brjod de /🔽sus sangs rgyas yongs su ma btang ba dang / chos yongs su ma btang ba dang / dge 'dun yongs su ma btang ba dang / 'das pa dang; ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yongs su ma btang ba dang /
analyzed: dga' bo / de bas na lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi mdun du brjod de / sus sangs rgyas yongs su ma btang ba dang / chos yongs su ma btang ba dang / dge 'dun yongs su ma btang ba dang / 'das pa dang; ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yongs su ma btang ba dang /
translated: Nanda, therefore, I proclaim it in the presence of the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.🔽Whoever does not abandon the Buddha, does not abandon the Dharma, does not abandon the Saṅgha, and does not abandon the blessed buddhas of the past, future, and present,

original: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub yongs su ma btang ba des /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub yongs su ma btang ba des /
translated: and does not abandon the awakening of the blessed buddhas of the past, future, and present,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su btang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su btang bar mi bya ste /
translated: Do not give away this perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di ni nga'i gdams ngag go /🔽dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / 'phel bar byad pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ni nga'i gdams ngag go / dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / 'phel bar byad pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang /
translated: This is my instruction.🔽Nanda, any son of a good family or daughter of a good family who takes up, bears in mind, reads aloud, masters, and properly pays attention to this deep perfection of wisdom,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang / gzhan la'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di rnam grangs du mar rgyu cher 'chad pa dang / ston pa dang / rab tu ston pa dang / shes par byed pa dang / rab tu gzhog @94b pa dang /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang / gzhan la'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di rnam grangs du mar rgyu cher 'chad pa dang / ston pa dang / rab tu ston pa dang / shes par byed pa dang / rab tu gzhog @94b pa dang /
translated: and who for others explains, teaches, reveals, makes understood, makes them take it up,

original: 'grel pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / yang dag par ston pa'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar gyur pa yin /🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽dga' bo / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba ni /
