original: dga' bo / 'das pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin🔽pa nyid las byung ngo //🔽dga' bo; ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig 'byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang shes rab kyi pha
analyzed: dga' bo / 'das pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid las byung ngo // dga' bo; ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig 'byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang shes rab kyi pha
translated: “Ānanda, the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment of those Bhagavān Buddhas, those Tathāgatas, those Arhats, those Perfectly Awakened Ones, who have appeared in the past, has come from just this perfection of wisdom.🔽“Ānanda, the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment of those Bhagavān Buddhas, those Tathāgatas, those Arhats, those Perfectly Awakened Ones, who will appear in the future, will come from just this perfection of wisdom.

original: rol tu phyin pa nyid las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rol tu phyin pa nyid las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Ānanda, the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment of those Bhagavān Buddhas, those Tathāgatas, those Arhats, those Perfectly Awakened Ones, who have appeared in the present, has come from just this perfection of wisdom.

original: dga' bo / da ltar byung ba'i dus na shar phyogs dang / lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med tshad med dpag tu med pa dag na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang @95a *//
analyzed: dga' bo / da ltar byung ba'i dus na shar phyogs dang / lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med tshad med dpag tu med pa dag na / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang @95a *//
translated: “Ānanda, in the present, in the eastern direction and the southern, western and northern directions, the four intermediate directions, the zenith and the nadir, in countless, immeasurable, and limitless world systems,🔽however many tathāgatas, arhats, and perfectly awakened buddhas there are who are present,

original: dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid las byung ngo //
analyzed: dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid las byung ngo //
translated: who are living, who are enduring, who are teaching the Dharma, the unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening of those lord buddhas has also come from just this perfection of wisdom.

original: dga' bo / de bas na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la slob par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: dga' bo / de bas na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la slob par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, Ananda, the Bodhisattva-mahasattva who wishes to attain supreme perfect enlightenment and who wishes to train in the six perfections should train in this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dga' bo / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dga' bo / 'di lta ste /
translated: Ananda, it is like this:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ma ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ma ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the mother of the Bodhisattva-mahasattvas,

original: skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: who gives birth to them.

original: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la slob pa de dag thams cad ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la slob pa de dag thams cad ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Ananda, all those Bodhisattva-mahasattvas who train in the six perfections will attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: dga' bo / de bas na khyod la pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag yang dang yang yongs su gtad do //
analyzed: dga' bo / de bas na khyod la pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag yang dang yang yongs su gtad do //
translated: Therefore, Nanda, I entrust these six perfections to you again and again.

original: rjes su gtad do //
analyzed: rjes su gtad do //
translated: I hand them over to you.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dga' bo / 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi mdzod de /
analyzed: dga' bo / 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi mdzod de /
translated: Nanda, this is the Dharma treasury of the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas.

original: 'di ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mdzod ni zad mi shes pa'i chos kyi mdzod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mdzod ni zad mi shes pa'i chos kyi mdzod do //
translated: Thus, the treasury of the six perfections is an inexhaustible Dharma treasury.

original: dga' bo / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams @95b tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa dag na /
analyzed: dga' bo / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams @95b tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa dag na /
translated: Nanda, in the ten directions, in innumerable, countless, and limitless world systems,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mdzod 'di las chos ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mdzod 'di las chos ston to //
translated: all the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas who dwell, live, and remain, and who teach the Dharma, those blessed buddhas teach the Dharma from this treasury of the six perfections.

original: dga' bo / 'das pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig byung ba de dag kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag la bslabs nas /
analyzed: dga' bo / 'das pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig byung ba de dag kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag la bslabs nas /
translated: “Ānanda, all the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas of the past, as many as there are, having trained in these six perfections,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te chos bstan to //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te chos bstan to //
translated: have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening and have taught the Dharma.

original: dga' bo / ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig 'byung ba de dag kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag la bslabs te /
analyzed: dga' bo / ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig 'byung ba de dag kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag la bslabs te /
translated: “Ānanda, all the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas of the future, as many as there are, having trained in these six perfections,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te /
translated: will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: chos kyang ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyang ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will also teach the Dharma.🔽“

original: dga' bo / 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi nyan thos gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslabs te yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur to //🔽yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: dga' bo / 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi nyan thos gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslabs te yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur to // yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: Ananda, all the disciples of the Buddhas of the past, present, and future have attained Nirvana by training in this very perfection of wisdom.🔽They will attain Nirvana.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They are attaining Nirvana.

original: dga' bo / gal te khyod kyis gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams la @96a *//
analyzed: dga' bo / gal te khyod kyis gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams la @96a *//
translated: Ananda, if you were to teach the Dharma to the disciples of the Hearers' Vehicle,

original: nyan thos kyis brtsams te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyis brtsams te /
translated: beginning with the Hearers' Vehicle,

original: chos bstan pa'i chos bstan pa des stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad dgra bcom pa nyid mngon du byed par gyur kyang /
analyzed: chos bstan pa'i chos bstan pa des stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad dgra bcom pa nyid mngon du byed par gyur kyang /
translated: and if all the beings in the great trichiliocosm were to actualize the state of an arhat through that teaching of the Dharma,

original: da dung nyan thos khyod kyis nga'i nyan thos kyi bya ba byas par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: da dung nyan thos khyod kyis nga'i nyan thos kyi bya ba byas par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: you, a Hearer, would still not have done what a disciple of mine should do.

original: dga' bo / gal te khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i tshig 'ga' zhig brjod de bstan na /
analyzed: dga' bo / gal te khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i tshig 'ga' zhig brjod de bstan na /
translated: Nanda, if you were to say a few words to a bodhisattva great being about the perfection of wisdom,

original: nyan thos khyod kyis nga dgyes par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos khyod kyis nga dgyes par byas pa yin te /
translated: you would please me,

original: nyan thos kyis nyan thos kyi bya ba byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan thos kyis nyan thos kyi bya ba byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: and you would do a śrāvaka’s work.

original: dga' bo / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: dga' bo / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Nanda, what do you think?

original: chos bstan pa snga ma des stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad snga phyi med par dgra bcom pa nyid mngon du byed par gyur na /
analyzed: chos bstan pa snga ma des stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad snga phyi med par dgra bcom pa nyid mngon du byed par gyur na /
translated: If all the sentient beings there are in a great billionfold world system were to realize the state of a worthy one without remainder,

original: dgra bcom pa de dag gi sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgom pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po de dag mang ngam /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa de dag gi sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgom pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po de dag mang ngam /
translated: would the wholesome roots of those worthy ones—the wholesome roots that come from generosity, the wholesome roots that come from morality, and the wholesome roots that come from meditation—be a lot?🔽He replied,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: mang ngo // bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: mang ngo // bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: “Very much, Sugata!

original: mang ngo / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: mang ngo / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Very much, Blessed One!”

original: dga' bo / de bas gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa gang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la chung du na nyi ma gcig cig shes rab kyi pha rol tu @96b phyin pa dang ldan pa'i chos ston na /
analyzed: dga' bo / de bas gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa gang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la chung du na nyi ma gcig cig shes rab kyi pha rol tu @96b phyin pa dang ldan pa'i chos ston na /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Nanda, therefore, if a person belonging to the Hearers’ Vehicle were to teach the perfection of wisdom for even just one day to a bodhisattva great being,

original: de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the merit of that would be much greater.

original: dga' bo / nyin gcig lta zhog gi /
analyzed: dga' bo / nyin gcig lta zhog gi /
translated: “Nanda, let alone one day,

original: gal te nyi ma phyed dam /🔽dga' bo / nyi ma phyed lta zhog gi ;gal te snga dro gcig gam /
analyzed: gal te nyi ma phyed dam / dga' bo / nyi ma phyed lta zhog gi ;gal te snga dro gcig gam /
translated: if it were half a day,🔽“Nanda, let alone half a day,

original: dga' bo / snga dro gcig lta zhog gi /
analyzed: dga' bo / snga dro gcig lta zhog gi /
translated: if it were just one morning,🔽“Nanda, let alone one morning,

original: gal te chu tshod gcig tsam mam /
analyzed: gal te chu tshod gcig tsam mam /
translated: if it were just one hour,

original: dga' bo / chu tshod gcig tsam lta zhog gi /🔽gal te skad 'ga'/
analyzed: dga' bo / chu tshod gcig tsam lta zhog gi / gal te skad 'ga'/
translated: “Nanda, let alone one hour,🔽if it were just a few moments,

original: yud 'ga'/ thang 'ga' zhig gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pas /
analyzed: yud 'ga'/ thang 'ga' zhig gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pas /
translated: a few instants, a few seconds,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i chos bstan na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i chos bstan na /
translated: If the perfection of wisdom is taught to the bodhisattva great beings,

original: dga' bo // de'i bsod nams ni ches mang du 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dga' bo // de'i bsod nams ni ches mang du 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: then, Nanda, the merit that results would be much greater.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'ang des zil gyis non par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'ang des zil gyis non par 'gyur ro //
translated: The wholesome roots of all those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage in the vehicles of the hearers and the solitary realizers would be surpassed by that.

original: dga' bo / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa rnams la chung ngu na nyi ma gcig gam /
analyzed: dga' bo / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa rnams la chung ngu na nyi ma gcig gam /
translated: “Nanda, if a bodhisattva great being were to teach the perfection of wisdom to those in the Bodhisattva Vehicle, even for as little as a single day,

original: nyi ma phyed dam /
analyzed: nyi ma phyed dam /
translated: or half a day,

original: snga dro gcig gam /🔽chu tshod gcig tsam mam /
analyzed: snga dro gcig gam / chu tshod gcig tsam mam /
translated: or a single morning,🔽or even just for an hour,

original: skad 'ga'/ yud 'ga'/🔽thang 'ga' zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i chos ston na /
analyzed: skad 'ga'/ yud 'ga'/🔽thang 'ga' zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i chos ston na /
translated: or a few moments,🔽or a few instants,🔽or a few seconds,

original: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba zil gyis non par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba zil gyis non par 'gyur te /
translated: Nanda, those bodhisattva great beings surpass all the wholesome actions of the sons of noble family and daughters of noble family in the vehicles of the hearers and solitary buddhas.

original: de ci'i phyir @97a *//🔽zhe na / 'di ltar de ni bdag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod la /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir @97a *// zhe na / 'di ltar de ni bdag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod la /
translated: Why is that?🔽It is because they themselves wish to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood,

original: gzhan yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par bskul zhing /🔽yang dag par dga' bar byed pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par bskul zhing / yang dag par dga' bar byed pa yin /
translated: and they encourage others to do the same.🔽They delight others.

original: yang dag par spro bar byed pa yin /🔽yang dag par gzhog pa yin /
analyzed: yang dag par spro bar byed pa yin / yang dag par gzhog pa yin /
translated: They inspire others.🔽They establish others.

original: yang dag par 'god pa yin te /
analyzed: yang dag par 'god pa yin te /
translated: They cause others to enter.

original: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang /
translated: Nanda, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices like this, practicing the six perfections, practicing the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of supernatural power,

original: dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang /
translated: the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, the four noble truths, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions,

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod pa dang /
translated: and the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the six sense fields of supernatural perception, the meditative stabilities, the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres @97b pa bco brgyad la spyod pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par 'phel ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las yongs su nyams pa'i gnas med /🔽skabs med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres @97b pa bco brgyad la spyod pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par 'phel ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las yongs su nyams pa'i gnas med / skabs med de /
translated: the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, and who have developed many wholesome roots, will not regress from unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment.🔽There is no such possibility.

original: de ni gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni gnas ma yin no //
translated: That is not possible.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bshad pa'i tshe /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bshad pa'i tshe /
translated: When this transcendent perfection of wisdom is being explained,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor bzhi dang / lha dang / mi dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po de ltar 'khod pa rnams kyi mdun du rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa gang mngon par 'du mdzad pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor bzhi dang / lha dang / mi dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po de ltar 'khod pa rnams kyi mdun du rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa gang mngon par 'du mdzad pas /
translated: The Blessed One, in the presence of the fourfold retinue, as well as gods, humans, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas, performed a miracle such that

original: thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa 'khor rgya mtsho lta bu /
analyzed: thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa 'khor rgya mtsho lta bu /
translated: they all saw the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Akṣobhya, who was surrounded by an ocean-like retinue,

original: 'khrug pa med pa /
analyzed: 'khrug pa med pa /
translated: without any disturbance,

original: kun kyang dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa /
analyzed: kun kyang dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa /
translated: all of whom were arhats whose defilements were exhausted,

original: nyon mongs pa med pa dbang du gyur pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa dbang du gyur pa /
translated: who were free from afflictions, who had mastered themselves,

original: sems shin tu rnam par grol ba /
analyzed: sems shin tu rnam par grol ba /
translated: whose minds were completely liberated,

original: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba /
analyzed: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba /
translated: whose insight was completely liberated,

original: cang shes pa /🔽glang po chen po bya ba byas pa /
analyzed: cang shes pa / glang po chen po bya ba byas pa /
translated: who were self-controlled,

original: byed pa byas pa /
analyzed: byed pa byas pa /
translated: great elephants, who had done what had to be done,🔽who had accomplished what had to be accomplished,

original: khur bor ba /
analyzed: khur bor ba /
translated: who had cast off their burdens,

original: rang gi don rjes su thob pa /
analyzed: rang gi don rjes su thob pa /
translated: who had attained their own welfare,

original: srid par sbyor ba yongs su zad pa /
analyzed: srid par sbyor ba yongs su zad pa /
translated: who had completely exhausted the bonds of existence,

original: bka' yang dag pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba /
analyzed: bka' yang dag pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba /
translated: who had liberated their minds through the true words,🔽and who had attained the perfection of the highest power over all minds.

original: sems thams cad la dbang dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa sha stag gi dge slong gi dge 'dun dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @98a *//🔽po sha stag gis kun nas bskor cing mdun du bdar ba mthong bar gyur pa de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa mngon par 'du mdzad do //
analyzed: sems thams cad la dbang dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa sha stag gi dge slong gi dge 'dun dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @98a *// po sha stag gis kun nas bskor cing mdun du bdar ba mthong bar gyur pa de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa mngon par 'du mdzad do //
translated: He was surrounded and attended by a great assembly of bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa de phyir brtul bar gyur te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa de phyir brtul bar gyur te /
translated: Then the Blessed One withdrew that miraculous manifestation.

original: rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa de phyir brtul bar gyur nas /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa de phyir brtul bar gyur nas /
translated: When he withdrew that miraculous manifestation,

original: 'khor bzhi po de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa'ang ma mthong /
analyzed: 'khor bzhi po de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa'ang ma mthong /
translated: the fourfold assembly no longer saw the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Akṣobhya,

original: gang zag nyan thos sam /
analyzed: gang zag nyan thos sam /
translated: nor the śrāvakas,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa de dag kyang ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa de dag kyang ma mthong ngo //
translated: They did not see the bodhisattvas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa'i sangs rgyas de'i zhing yang ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa'i sangs rgyas de'i zhing yang ma mthong ngo //
translated: nor did they see the buddha realm of the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Akṣobhya.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun yang mig lam na mi snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun yang mig lam na mi snang bar gyur to //
translated: The buddhas and the rest of the saṅgha of monks disappeared from their vision.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why was that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
translated: The thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha

original: rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa phyir brtul ba mdzad pas /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa phyir brtul ba mdzad pas /
translated: had withdrawn his miraculous display.🔽That was why they could not see.

original: de'i phyir de dag gis mi mthong bar gyur to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gis mi mthong bar gyur to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Nanda,🔽“Nanda, do you see the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Akṣobhya?”🔽“No, Blessed One, I do not see him.”🔽“Nanda, do you see the bodhisattvas?”🔽“No, Blessed One, I do not see them.”🔽“Nanda, do you see the buddha realm of the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Akṣobhya?”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: “No, Blessed One, I do not see it.”🔽“Nanda, do you see the buddhas and the rest of the saṅgha of monks?”🔽“No, Blessed One, I do not see them.”🔽“Nanda, do you see the bodhisattva mahāsattva Akṣayamati?”🔽“No, Blessed One, I do not see him.”🔽“Nanda, do you see the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara?”🔽“No, Blessed One, I do not see him.”🔽“Nanda, do you see the bodhisattva mahāsattva Mahā­sthāmaprāpta?”🔽“No, Blessed One, I do not see him.”🔽“Nanda, do you see the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajrapāṇi?”🔽“No, Blessed One, I do not see him.”🔽“Nanda, do you see the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya?”🔽“No, Blessed One, I do not see him.”🔽“Nanda, do you see the bodhisattva mahāsattva Kṣitigarbha?”🔽“No, Blessed One, I do not see him.”🔽“Nanda, do you see the bodhisattva mahāsattva Ākāśagarbha?”🔽“No, Blessed One, I do not see him.”🔽“Nanda, do you see the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara?”🔽“No, Blessed One, I do not see him.”🔽“Nanda, do you see the bodhisattva mahāsattva Mahā

original: dga' bo / khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa mi 'khrugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa dang / dge slong gi dge @98b 'dun dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun mthong ngam /
analyzed: dga' bo / khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa mi 'khrugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa dang / dge slong gi dge @98b 'dun dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun mthong ngam /
translated: Nanda, did you see that buddhafield of the Tathagata Ak�abhairava, that Tathagata Arhat Samyaksambuddha Ak�abhairava, that community of monks, and that community of bodhisattvas?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de'ang ma mthong /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de'ang ma mthong /
translated: I did not see that buddhafield,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de'ang ma mthong /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de'ang ma mthong /
translated: I did not see that Tathagata,

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun de'ang ma mthong /
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun de'ang ma mthong /
translated: I did not see that community of monks,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun de'ang ma mthong ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun de'ang ma mthong ste /
translated: I did not see that community of bodhisattvas.

original: mig lam du'ang mi gda'o //
analyzed: mig lam du'ang mi gda'o //
translated: They did not appear to my eyes.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said,

original: dga' bo / de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang mig lam du snang ba ma yin te /🔽chos la chos snang bar mi 'gyur /🔽chos kyis chos mi mthong /
analyzed: dga' bo / de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang mig lam du snang ba ma yin te / chos la chos snang bar mi 'gyur / chos kyis chos mi mthong /
translated: Nanda, in the same way, all phenomena do not appear to the eyes.🔽Phenomena do not appear to phenomena.🔽Phenomena do not see phenomena.

original: chos kyis chos mi shes so //
analyzed: chos kyis chos mi shes so //
translated: Phenomena do not know phenomena.

original: dga' bo / ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa dang / nyan thos de dag dang / gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa de dag dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag mig lam du snang bar ma gyur pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang mig lam du snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dga' bo / ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa dang / nyan thos de dag dang / gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa de dag dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag mig lam du snang bar ma gyur pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang mig lam du snang ba ma yin te /
translated: Ananda, just as the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha Akshobya, those shravakas, those individuals who are in the Bodhisattva Vehicle, and those buddha-fields do not appear in the path of your vision, in the same way, all dharmas do not appear in the path of your vision.

original: chos la chos snang bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: chos la chos snang bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Dharmas do not appear as dharmas.

original: chos kyis chos mi mthong /
analyzed: chos kyis chos mi mthong /
translated: Dharmas do not see dharmas.

original: chos kyis chos mi shes so //
analyzed: chos kyis chos mi shes so //
translated: Dharmas do not know dharmas.

original: dga' bo / chos thams cad ni shes pa med pa /
analyzed: dga' bo / chos thams cad ni shes pa med pa /
translated: Ananda, all dharmas are unknowable,

original: mthong ba med pa /
analyzed: mthong ba med pa /
translated: unseeable,

original: byed pa med pa /
analyzed: byed pa med pa /
translated: without action,

original: bya ba la mthu med pa sha stag ste /
analyzed: bya ba la mthu med pa sha stag ste /
translated: and without power to act.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dga' bo / chos thams cad ni nam mkha' ltar byed pa med pas /
analyzed: dga' bo / chos thams cad ni nam mkha' ltar byed pa med pas /
translated: Ananda, all dharmas are like space, without action,

original: byed pa med cing 'dzin pa med pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa med cing 'dzin pa med pa'o //
translated: without doing, and without grasping.

original: dga' bo / chos thams cad ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu lta bu ste /
analyzed: dga' bo / chos thams cad ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu lta bu ste /
translated: Ananda, all dharmas are like an illusory person.

original: bsam gyi mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gyi mi khyab pa'o //
translated: It is inconceivable.

original: dga' bo / chos thams cad ni @99a *//
analyzed: dga' bo / chos thams cad ni @99a *//
translated: Nanda, all phenomena

original: sems dang bral zhing rnam par bsgrubs pas so sor gnas pa'i mtshan nyid med de /
analyzed: sems dang bral zhing rnam par bsgrubs pas so sor gnas pa'i mtshan nyid med de /
translated: are devoid of mind and are established separately without characteristics.

original: snying po med pa'i phyir tshor ba med pa'o //
analyzed: snying po med pa'i phyir tshor ba med pa'o //
translated: They are without feeling because they are without essence.

original: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ste /
translated: A bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices like this practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos gang la'ang mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: chos gang la'ang mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He does not become attached to any phenomenon.

original: dga' bo / de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa ste /
analyzed: dga' bo / de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa ste /
translated: Nanda, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who trains like this trains in the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: A bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to complete all the perfections should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar slob pa ni rab ces bya'o //🔽gtso bo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar slob pa ni rab ces bya'o // gtso bo zhes bya'o //
translated: One who trains like this is called ‘excellent.’🔽He is called ‘foremost.’

original: mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: mchog ces bya'o //
translated: He is called ‘supreme.’

original: dam pa zhes bya'o //🔽phul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dam pa zhes bya'o // phul zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “sacred.”🔽It is called “supreme.”

original: gya nom pa zhes bya'o //🔽bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gya nom pa zhes bya'o // bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “excellent.”🔽It is called “unsurpassed.”

original: gong na med pa zhes bya'o //🔽mnyam pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gong na med pa zhes bya'o // mnyam pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “incomparable.”🔽It is called “unequalled.”

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “equal to the unequalled.”

original: 'jig rten thams cad la phan pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad la phan pa /
translated: It is beneficial to the entire world.

original: 'jig rten thams cad la bde ba //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad la bde ba //
translated: It brings happiness to the entire world.

original: mgon med pa rnams kyi mgon du gyur pa /
analyzed: mgon med pa rnams kyi mgon du gyur pa /
translated: It is the protector of those without protection.

original: sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba /
translated: It is approved by the Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyis bsngags pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis bsngags pa ste /
translated: It is praised by the Buddhas.

original: de la gnas shing de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di phyag g-yas pas gyen du bteg cing phyir gzhog kyang sems @99b can de dag gis stong gsum gyi stong chen🔽po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di bteg go zhes bya ba dang / bzhag go zhes bya bar mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnas shing de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di phyag g-yas pas gyen du bteg cing phyir gzhog kyang sems @99b can de dag gis stong gsum gyi stong chen🔽po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di bteg go zhes bya ba dang / bzhag go zhes bya bar mi shes pa'o //
translated: The Tathāgatas, the Saints, the genuinely and fully awake Buddhas, standing in that, can raise up with their right hand this three-billion-fold world-realm and put it back, and the beings there would not know “We were carried up and we were put down.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dga' bo / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de nyid la bslabs pas 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams la thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i ye shes gzigs pa grub pa yin te /
analyzed: dga' bo / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de nyid la bslabs pas 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams la thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i ye shes gzigs pa grub pa yin te /
translated: Nanda, the Lord Buddhas of the past, future, and present have also accomplished the unobstructed wisdom vision with regard to past, future, and present phenomena by training in just that perfection of wisdom.

original: dga' bo / bslab pa gang ji snyed cig yod pa'i bslab pa thams cad kyi nang na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab pa ni rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: dga' bo / bslab pa gang ji snyed cig yod pa'i bslab pa thams cad kyi nang na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab pa ni rab ces bya'o //
translated: Nanda, among all the trainings that exist, the training in the perfection of wisdom is called the best.

original: gtso bo zhes bya'o //🔽mchog ces bya'o //🔽dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gtso bo zhes bya'o // mchog ces bya'o // dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the foremost.🔽It is called the supreme.

original: phul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phul zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the excellent.

original: gya nom pa zhes bya'o //🔽bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gya nom pa zhes bya'o // bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the sublime.🔽It is called the refined.

original: gong na med pa zhes bya'o //🔽mnyam pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gong na med pa zhes bya'o // mnyam pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the unsurpassed.🔽It is called the unequaled.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the equal of the unequaled.

original: dga' bo / gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshad gzung ba'am mtha' btsal bar 'dod pa de ni /
analyzed: dga' bo / gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshad gzung ba'am mtha' btsal bar 'dod pa de ni /
translated: Nanda, whoever wishes to measure the perfection of wisdom or to find its limits

original: nam mkha' la tshad gzung ba dang mtha' btsal bar 'dod du zad do //
analyzed: nam mkha' la tshad gzung ba dang mtha' btsal bar 'dod du zad do //
translated: is like someone who wishes to measure or find the limits of space.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: dga' bo / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshad med pa ste /
analyzed: dga' bo / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshad med pa ste /
translated: Nanda, the perfection of wisdom is immeasurable.

original: dga' bo / ngas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ched du bstan pa med do //
analyzed: dga' bo / ngas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ched du bstan pa med do //
translated: Nanda, I have not taught the perfection of wisdom with a specific intention.

original: ming mang po dang / tshig mang po dang; 'bru mang po la ni tshad yod kyi /
analyzed: ming mang po dang / tshig mang po dang; 'bru mang po la ni tshad yod kyi /
translated: Many names, many words, and many syllables have limits,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni tshad med do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni tshad med do //
translated: but the perfection of wisdom is limitless.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Bhagavān,

original: ci'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la tshad ma mchis pa lags /
analyzed: ci'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la tshad ma mchis pa lags /
translated: why is the perfection of wisdom limitless?”

original: @100a *// bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: @100a *// bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied, “

original: dga' bo / mi zad pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la tshad med do //
analyzed: dga' bo / mi zad pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la tshad med do //
translated: Nanda, the perfection of wisdom is limitless because it is inexhaustible.”

original: dga' bo / dben pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la tshad med do //
analyzed: dga' bo / dben pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la tshad med do //
translated: Ananda, the perfection of wisdom is immeasurable because of its isolation.

original: dga' bo / 'das pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig byung ba de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las byung ste /
analyzed: dga' bo / 'das pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig byung ba de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las byung ste /
translated: Ananda, all the Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones of the past have come forth from this very perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zad par ma gyur to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zad par ma gyur to //
translated: The perfection of wisdom has not been exhausted.

original: dga' bo / ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig 'byung ba de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las 'byung ste /
analyzed: dga' bo / ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig 'byung ba de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las 'byung ste /
translated: Ananda, all the Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones of the future will come forth from this very perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zad par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zad par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom will not be exhausted.

original: dga' bo / da ltar phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las byung ste /
analyzed: dga' bo / da ltar phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las byung ste /
translated: Ananda, all the Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones, who are now in the world in the ten directions, those Blessed Buddhas who are living, remaining in life for the sake of those beings who need to be taught, and who are teaching the Dharma, they too have come forth from this very perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma zad do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma zad do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom has not been exhausted.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: dga' bo / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zad par bya bar sems pa de ni nam mkha' zad par bya bar sems su zad de /
analyzed: dga' bo / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zad par bya bar sems pa de ni nam mkha' zad par bya bar sems su zad de /
translated: Ananda, he who thinks that the perfection of wisdom can be exhausted, he thinks that space can be exhausted.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma zad /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma zad /
translated: The perfection of wisdom has not been exhausted,

original: mi zad / zad par @100b mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi zad / zad par @100b mi 'gyur ro //
translated: is not exhausted, will not be exhausted.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma zad /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma zad /
translated: the perfection of meditative stability, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity are not exhausted,

original: mi zad / zad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi zad / zad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: are inexhaustible, and will not come to an end.

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni ma zad /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni ma zad /
translated: Inner emptiness, outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, and so on up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature are not exhausted,

original: mi zad / zad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi zad / zad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: are inexhaustible, and will not come to an end.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni ma zad /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni ma zad /
translated: The applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of awakening, and the eightfold noble path are not exhausted,

original: mi zad / zad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi zad / zad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: are inexhaustible, and will not come to an end.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang /
translated: signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the clairvoyances,

original: rnam par thar pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams ni ma zad /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams ni ma zad /
translated: the deliverances, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways are not exhausted,

original: mi zad / zad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi zad / zad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: are not being exhausted, and will not be exhausted.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang; mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni ma zad /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang; mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni ma zad /
translated: The ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are not exhausted,

original: mi zad / zad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi zad / zad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: are not being exhausted, and will not be exhausted.

original: rnam pa thams cad @101a *//
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad @101a *//
translated: All the aspects

original: cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni ma zad /
analyzed: cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni ma zad /
translated: up to omniscience are not exhausted,

original: mi zad / zad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi zad / zad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: are not being exhausted, and will not be exhausted.

original: chos de dag la ni skye ba'ang med na /
analyzed: chos de dag la ni skye ba'ang med na /
translated: Those phenomena have no arising,

original: de dag zad par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de dag zad par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: so how could they be exhausted?

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ljags kyi dbang po bkram ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ljags kyi dbang po bkram ste /
translated: Then the Blessed One extended his tongue,

original: zhal gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad ljags kyi dbang pos yongs su bkab nas /
analyzed: zhal gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad ljags kyi dbang pos yongs su bkab nas /
translated: and with it covered his entire face,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: and said to the venerable Nanda:

original: dga' bo / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: dga' bo / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Nanda?

original: lce'i dbang po 'di lta bu dang ldan pa log par smra ba'am /
analyzed: lce'i dbang po 'di lta bu dang ldan pa log par smra ba'am /
translated: Could someone with such a tongue as this speak falsely,

original: gzhan du smra bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: gzhan du smra bar 'gyur ram /
translated: or speak otherwise?🔽” He replied:

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,🔽no, it could not.

original: ma lags so; ;bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: ma lags so; ;bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: Well-Gone One,

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: it could not.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Blessed One said:

original: dga' bo / de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'khor bzhi la rgya cher ston cig /
analyzed: dga' bo / de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'khor bzhi la rgya cher ston cig /
translated: “Therefore, Nanda, teach this perfection of wisdom extensively to the fourfold assembly,

original: rjod cig / sgrogs shig /🔽shod cig / khod cig /🔽rab tu khod cig /
analyzed: rjod cig / sgrogs shig / shod cig / khod cig / rab tu khod cig /
translated: recite it, proclaim it,

original: khrol cig / rnam par phye zhig /
analyzed: khrol cig / rnam par phye zhig /
translated: explain it, elucidate it,

original: gsal bar gyis shig /
analyzed: gsal bar gyis shig /
translated: make it clear,🔽unravel it,

original: yang dag par ston cig /
analyzed: yang dag par ston cig /
translated: and demonstrate it correctly.

original: dga' bo / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di las gang la nyan thos kyi theg pa pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa dang / gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pas bslab par bya ba dang /
analyzed: dga' bo / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di las gang la nyan thos kyi theg pa pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa dang / gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pas bslab par bya ba dang /
translated: Ananda, in this profound perfection of wisdom are taught in detail all the dharmas in which those of the vehicle of the Disciples, of the vehicle of the Bodhisattvas, and of the vehicle of the Pratyekabuddhas should train,

original: gang la ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bslabs pas rang rang gi sa la gnas par 'gyur ba'i chos thams cad rgya cher bstan te /
analyzed: gang la ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bslabs pas rang rang gi sa la gnas par 'gyur ba'i chos thams cad rgya cher bstan te /
translated: and in which, by training in accordance with the teaching, they will stand in their respective states.

original: dga' bo / shes rab kyi @101b pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni yi ge thams cad la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dga' bo / shes rab kyi @101b pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni yi ge thams cad la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Ananda, this profound perfection of wisdom is the entrance into all the letters.

original: dga' bo / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni gsungs kyi sgo gang la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par bya ba'i gzungs thams cad kyi sgo yin te /
analyzed: dga' bo / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni gsungs kyi sgo gang la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par bya ba'i gzungs thams cad kyi sgo yin te /
translated: Ananda, this profound perfection of wisdom is the door of all the dharanis in which the Bodhisattva, the great being, should train.

original: gzungs 'di 'dzin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la ni spobs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa'i sgo thams cad mngon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzungs 'di 'dzin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la ni spobs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa'i sgo thams cad mngon du 'gyur ro //
translated: For the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who uphold this dhāraṇī, all the doors of eloquence and correct understanding will manifest.

original: dga' bo / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dam pa'i chos mi zad pa'i mdzod ngas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dga' bo / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dam pa'i chos mi zad pa'i mdzod ngas bshad pa'o //
translated: Nanda, I have explained this perfection of wisdom as the inexhaustible treasure of the sublime Dharma of the past, future, and present buddhas, the blessed ones.

original: dga' po / de bas na khyod kyis yid ches pa dang / khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: dga' po / de bas na khyod kyis yid ches pa dang / khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: Nanda, therefore you should have faith and understanding.

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chad pa dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chad pa dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: Those who uphold, explain, read, and master this profound perfection of wisdom hold the enlightenment of the past, future, and present buddhas, the blessed ones.

original: dga' bo / khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzungs gang gzung bas /
analyzed: dga' bo / khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzungs gang gzung bas /
translated: Nanda, you should hold the dhāraṇī of the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos thams cad gzung bar 'gyur ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzungs ngas bstan pa ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad gzung bar 'gyur ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzungs ngas bstan pa ni 'di yin no //
translated: “Ānanda, the dhāraṇī of the perfection of wisdom that you should hold is the dhāraṇī of the perfection of wisdom that I have taught, by which you will hold all dharmas.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines,

original: le'u lnga bcu pa'o ////
analyzed: le'u lnga bcu pa'o ////
translated: this was chapter fifty.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines

original: bam po lnga bcu bdun pa /
analyzed: bam po lnga bcu bdun pa /
translated: fascicle forty-seven

original: @102a *// de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'di snyam du 'gyur te /
analyzed: @102a *// de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'di snyam du 'gyur te /
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti thought this:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang zab /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang zab /
translated: “The perfection of wisdom is profound.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub kyang zab na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub kyang zab na /
translated: The awakening of the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened ones is also profound.

original: bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la de dri'o snyam ste /
analyzed: bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la de dri'o snyam ste /
translated: I will ask the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One about this.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord!

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mi bas pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mi bas pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is inexhaustible.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor / nam mkha' mi zad pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / nam mkha' mi zad pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi zad pa'o //
translated: “Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is inexhaustible because space is inexhaustible.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” Subhuti said:

original: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bgyi /
translated: “Lord, how is the perfection of wisdom to be accomplished?

original: bcom ldan kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor / gzugs mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: “Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is to be accomplished by the inexhaustibility of form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: and by the inexhaustibility of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness.

original: rab 'byor / skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom should be practiced because the sense fields, elements, and dependent origination are inexhaustible.

original: rab 'byor / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom should be practiced because the perfection of generosity is inexhaustible.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha @102b rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha @102b rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom should be practiced because they are inexhaustible.

original: rab 'byor / nang stong pa nyid mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / nang stong pa nyid mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom should be practiced because inner emptiness is inexhaustible.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //🔽rab 'byor / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o // rab 'byor / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is inexhaustible, one should accomplish the perfection of wisdom.🔽Subhūti, since the applications of mindfulness are inexhaustible, one should accomplish the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, since the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and the eightfold noble path are inexhaustible, one should accomplish the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang; rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang; rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished through the imperishability of the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang; gzungs kyi sgo mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //🔽rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag @103a *//
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang; gzungs kyi sgo mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o // rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag @103a *//
translated: wishlessness, the superknowledges, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways.🔽Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished through the imperishability of the powers, fearlessnesses,

original: par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: correct understandings, and unique qualities of the tathāgatas.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //🔽rab 'byor / gzhan yang gzugs nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o // rab 'byor / gzhan yang gzugs nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhuti, up to the knowledge of all modes is inexhaustible, therefore should the perfection of wisdom be accomplished.🔽Furthermore, Subhuti, form is inexhaustible like space, therefore should the perfection of wisdom be accomplished by the Bodhisattva, the great being.

original: rab 'byor / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhuti, feeling, perception, the formative forces, and consciousness are inexhaustible like space, therefore should the perfection of wisdom be accomplished by the Bodhisattva, the great being.

original: rab 'byor / skye mched dang / khams dang; rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / skye mched dang / khams dang; rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhuti : Because the sense fields, elements, and the dependent origination are inexhaustible like space, therefore should the perfection of wisdom be accomplished by the Bodhisattva, the great being.

original: rab 'byor / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhuti : Because the perfection of giving is inexhaustible like space, therefore should the perfection of wisdom be accomplished.🔽Because the perfection of morality, patience, vigour, and concentration are inexhaustible like space, therefore should the perfection of wisdom be accomplished.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab pha rol tu phyin pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi @103b shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab pha rol tu phyin pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi @103b shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Because the perfection of wisdom is inexhaustible like space, therefore should the perfection of wisdom be accomplished.

original: rab 'byor / nang stong pa nyid nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //🔽dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / nang stong pa nyid nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o // dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished as the emptiness of internal phenomena, which is inexhaustible like space.🔽The perfection of wisdom should be accomplished as the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-discarded phenomena, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, which are inexhaustible like space.

original: rab 'byor / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished as the applications of mindfulness, which are inexhaustible like space.

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be accomplished as the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path, which are inexhaustible like space.

original: rab 'byor / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished through the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //🔽rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / @104a *//
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o // rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / @104a *//
translated: wishlessness, the superknowledges, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways, which are inexhaustible like space.🔽Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished through the powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, which are inexhaustible like space.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhuti, up to the knowledge of all modes is like space, inexhaustible; therefore should the perfection of wisdom be accomplished.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang ma rig pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang ma rig pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, should accomplish the perfection of wisdom because of the inexhaustibility of ignorance which is like space.

original: rab 'byor / 'du byed nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //🔽rab 'byor / rnam par shes pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'du byed nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o // rab 'byor / rnam par shes pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, should accomplish the perfection of wisdom because of the inexhaustibility of the formative forces which are like space.🔽Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, should accomplish the perfection of wisdom because of the inexhaustibility of consciousness which is like space.

original: rab 'byor / ming dang gzugs nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ming dang gzugs nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas /
translated: Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, should accomplish the perfection of wisdom because of the inexhaustibility of name-and-form which is like space.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Bodhisattva great beings should accomplish the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / skye mched drug nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / skye mched drug nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas /
translated: Subhūti, the six sense fields are inexhaustible like space,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rnam par lta ba dang / shin tu rnam par spang ba la rnam par lta ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rnam par lta ba dang / shin tu rnam par spang ba la rnam par lta ba ste /

analyzed: gang de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rnam par lta ba de ni /
