translated: This is the unshared quality of a bodhisattva great being who is seated at the site of awakening.

original: de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rnam par lta ba de ni /
analyzed: de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rnam par lta ba de ni /
translated: “In that way, one who views dependent origination

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes thob par 'gyur ro //

original: rab 'byor / gang la la nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas mngon par bsgrub pa 'dis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rnam par lta ba de ni nyan thos kyi sa'am /

original: chos gang yang rgyu med pa las byung bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: chos gang yang rgyu med pa las byung bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see any phenomena arising without a cause.

original: chos gang yang rtag par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: chos gang yang rtag par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see any phenomena as permanent.

original: chos gang yang 'gag par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: chos gang yang 'gag par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see any phenomena as ceasing.

original: chos gang yang bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / 'gro ba dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed can dang / shed bdag dang / byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa po dang /
analyzed: chos gang yang bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / 'gro ba dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed can dang / shed bdag dang / byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa po dang /
translated: They do not see any phenomena as a self, a sentient being, a life-force, a person, an individual, a human, a human being, an agent, an instigator,

original: slong ba po dang / yongs su slong ba po @106a *//🔽dang; tshor ba po dang / tshor du 'jug pa po dang / shes pa po dang / lta ba por yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: slong ba po dang / yongs su slong ba po @106a *// dang; tshor ba po dang / tshor du 'jug pa po dang / shes pa po dang / lta ba por yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: an instigator of actions,🔽a feeler, an instigator of feelings, a knower, or a seer.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag dang bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang ma zhi bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag dang bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang ma zhi bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: They do not see anything as permanent or impermanent, as happiness or suffering, as a self or not a self, or as peaceful or not peaceful.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom like this,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam par blta bar bya'o //

analyzed: rab 'byor / gang gi tshe / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de'i tshe /

analyzed: gzugs rtag pa'am mi rtag pa'am /

original: bde ba'am sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: bde ba'am sdug bsngal ba'am /

analyzed: bde ba'am sdug bsngal ba'am /

analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rtag pa'am mi rtag pa'am /

original: bde ba'am sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: bde ba'am sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: as happiness or suffering,

original: bdag yod pa'am bdag med pa'am /
analyzed: bdag yod pa'am bdag med pa'am /

translated: He does not see all the perfections, all the emptinesses, or the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment as permanent or impermanent,

original: bde ba'am sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: bde ba'am sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: as happiness or suffering,

original: bdag yod pa'am bdag med pa'am /
analyzed: bdag yod pa'am bdag med pa'am /
translated: as a self or not a self,

original: zhi ba'am ma zhi bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: zhi ba'am ma zhi bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: or as peaceful or not peaceful.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang /

translated: He does not see the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, the liberations, the samādhis,

original: bde ba'am sdug bsngal pa'am /
analyzed: bde ba'am sdug bsngal pa'am /
translated: as imbued with happiness or with suffering,

original: bdag yod pa'am bdag med pa'am /
analyzed: bdag yod pa'am bdag med pa'am /
translated: as a self or not as a self,

original: bde ba'am sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: bde ba'am sdug bsngal ba'am /

original: bdag yod pa'am ba dag med pa'am /
analyzed: bdag yod pa'am ba dag med pa'am /

original: zhi ba'am ma zhi bar yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: zhi ba'am ma zhi bar yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
translated: or as calm or not calm.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Su­bhūti, it is because when great bodhisattva beings practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: They do not see the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rjes su mthong bar 'gyur ba'i chos de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rjes su mthong bar 'gyur ba'i chos de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see the dharma by which they would see the perfection of wisdom.

original: bsam @107a *// gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: bsam @107a *// gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: They do not see the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, or the perfection of giving.

original: chos gang gis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rjes su mthong bar 'gyur pa'i chos de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo; ;nang stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: chos gang gis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rjes su mthong bar 'gyur pa'i chos de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo; ;nang stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: They do not see the dharma by which they would see the perfection of giving. They do not see inner emptiness.

original: chos gang gis nang stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mthong bar 'gyur ba'i chos de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: chos gang gis nang stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mthong bar 'gyur ba'i chos de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: They do not see that dharma by which they would see inner emptiness, and they do not see that dharma by which they would see outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, the emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of the compounded, the emptiness of the uncompounded, the emptiness of what is beyond extremes, the emptiness of no beginning or end, the emptiness of what is not to be discarded, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all dharmas, the emptiness of its own mark, the emptiness of not apprehending, the emptiness of a basic nature, the emptiness of all inner dharmas, the emptiness of all outer dharmas, the emptiness of outer and inner dharmas, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of the great, the emptiness of the ultimate, the emptiness of what is beyond extremes, the emptiness of what is not to be discarded, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all marks, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of an intrinsic nature, the emptiness of non-entities, and the emptiness of the nature of non-entities.🔽They do not see the perfection of giving, and they do not see the perfection of morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, or wisdom.

original: chos gang gis dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mthong bar 'gyur ba'i chos de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos gang gis dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mthong bar 'gyur ba'i chos de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see the emptiness of form, and they do not see the emptiness of feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.🔽They do not see the emptiness of the eyes, and they do not see the emptiness of the ears, nose, tongue, body, or mind.🔽They do not see the emptiness of a form, and they do not see the emptiness of a sound, a smell, a taste, a feeling, or a dharma.🔽They do not see the emptiness of the sensory element of the eyes, and they do not see the emptiness of the sensory element of sights, the sensory element of eye consciousness, the sensory element of contact associated with the eyes, or the sensory element of feeling that arises from the condition of contact associated with the eyes.🔽They do not see the emptiness of the sensory element of the ears, the sensory element of sounds, the sensory element of ear consciousness, the sensory element of contact associated with the ears, or the sensory element of feeling that arises from the condition of contact associated with the ears.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: They do not see the emptiness of the sensory element of the nose, the sensory element of smells, the sensory element of nose consciousness, the sensory element

original: chos gang gis 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yang dag par rjes su mthong bar 'gyur ba'i chos de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos gang gis 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yang dag par rjes su mthong bar 'gyur ba'i chos de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see any dharma by which they might see the noble eightfold path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam @107b par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam @107b par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: They do not see the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: or wishlessness. They do not see the higher knowledges, the meditative stabilizations, or the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: chos gang gis gzungs kyi sgo yang dag par rjes su mthong bar 'gyur ba'i chos de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo /
analyzed: chos gang gis gzungs kyi sgo yang dag par rjes su mthong bar 'gyur ba'i chos de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo /
translated: They do not see any dharma by which they might see the dhāraṇī gateways.🔽“

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: They do not see the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four unhindered discernments, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: chos gang gis sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yang dag par rjes su mthong bar 'gyur ba'i chos de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos gang gis sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yang dag par rjes su mthong bar 'gyur ba'i chos de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see the Dharma by means of which they would see the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four unhindered discernments, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: They do not see the knowledge of all aspects.

original: chos gang gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mthong bar 'gyur ba'i chos de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos gang gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mthong bar 'gyur ba'i chos de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see the Dharma by means of which they would see the knowledge of all aspects.

original: chos gang gis bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spang bar bya ba de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos gang gis bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spang bar bya ba de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see the Dharma by means of which they would abandon the latent impressions and propensities.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //🔽rab 'byor / gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad mi dmigs par shes rab kyi pha @108a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o // rab 'byor / gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad mi dmigs par shes rab kyi pha @108a *//
translated: In this way, Subhūti, should the bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, without apprehending anything.🔽Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom without apprehending anything,

original: rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de'i tshe /
translated: at that time

original: bdud sdig to can mya ngan gyi zug rngus zug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdud sdig to can mya ngan gyi zug rngus zug par 'gyur ro //
translated: the evil Māra is pierced by the dart of sorrow.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / skyes bu zhig pha ma 'chi ba'i dus byas par gyur na /🔽mya ngan gyi zug rngus zug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dper na / skyes bu zhig pha ma 'chi ba'i dus byas par gyur na / mya ngan gyi zug rngus zug par 'gyur te /
translated: for example, when a man’s parents die,🔽he is pierced by the dart of sorrow

original: mya ngan gyi zug rngu mi bzad pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mya ngan gyi zug rngu mi bzad pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: and has an unbearable dart of sorrow.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad mi dmigs par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad mi dmigs par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom without apprehending anything,

original: bdud sdig to can mya ngan gyi zug rngus zug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdud sdig to can mya ngan gyi zug rngus zug par 'gyur te /
translated: The evil Māra will be struck by the pain of anguish.

original: mya ngan gyi zug rngu mi bzad pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mya ngan gyi zug rngu mi bzad pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be struck by the unbearable pain of anguish.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: ci lags / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: ci lags / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: bdud sdig to can gcig 'ga' zhig mya ngan gyi zug rngu mi bzad pas zug par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: bdud sdig to can gcig 'ga' zhig mya ngan gyi zug rngu mi bzad pas zug par 'gyur ram /
translated: will just one evil Māra be struck by the unbearable pain of anguish?

original: 'on te stong gsum gyi stong chen pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bdud sdig to can gang ji snyed cig ma chis pa de dag thams cad mya ngan gyi zug rngu mi bzad pas zug par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te stong gsum gyi stong chen pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bdud sdig to can gang ji snyed cig ma chis pa de dag thams cad mya ngan gyi zug rngu mi bzad pas zug par 'gyur /
translated: Or will all the evil Māras in the great billionfold world system be struck by the unbearable pain of anguish?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par spyod pas rnam par spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par spyod pas rnam par spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings who are practicing the perfection of wisdom practice,

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na /
translated: in the great billionfold world system

original: bdud sdig to can gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad mya ngan gyi zug rngu mi bzad pas zug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdud sdig to can gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad mya ngan gyi zug rngu mi bzad pas zug par 'gyur te /
translated: All the evil demons will be seized by unbearable anguish.

original: rang rang gi stan la 'dug mi @108b 'dod do //
analyzed: rang rang gi stan la 'dug mi @108b 'dod do //
translated: They will not want to sit on their own seats.

original: de ltar rnam par spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la ni lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis gang gi phyir de bzung zhing phyir bzlog pa'i glags mi rnyed /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la ni lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis gang gi phyir de bzung zhing phyir bzlog pa'i glags mi rnyed /
translated: The world with its gods, humans, and asuras will not find an opportunity to seize and turn back the bodhisattva great being who practices like this.

original: gting mi rnyed do //
analyzed: gting mi rnyed do //
translated: They will not find a chance to seize him.

original: rab 'byor / de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas /
translated: Subhūti, therefore, the bodhisattva great beings who want to quickly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par spyod pas rnam par spyod par bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par spyod pas rnam par spyod par bya ste /
translated: should practice by practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par spyod pas rnam par spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par spyod pas rnam par spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom by way of the perfection of wisdom will complete the cultivation of the perfection of generosity.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: He will complete the cultivation of the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par spyod pas rnam par spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par spyod pas rnam par spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom by way of the perfection of wisdom will complete the cultivation of all the perfections.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti🔽said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: “Lord, how should a bodhisattva mahāsattva who wants to fully understand the perfection of wisdom practice the perfection of wisdom?🔽How should he stand?🔽How should he sit?🔽How should he lie down?🔽How should he go?🔽How should he come?🔽How should he look around?🔽How should he look straight ahead?🔽How should he bend his arm?🔽How should he stretch his arm?🔽How should he eat?🔽How should he not eat?🔽How should he sleep?🔽How should he not sleep?🔽How should he speak?🔽How should he be silent?”🔽The Lord said, “Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who wants to fully understand the perfection of wisdom should not stand for the sake of standing, should not sit for the sake of sitting, should not lie down for the sake of lying down, should not go for the sake of going, should not come for the sake of coming, should not look around for the sake of looking around, should not look straight ahead for the sake of looking straight ahead, should not bend his arm for the sake of bending his arm, should not stretch his arm for the sake of stretching his arm, should not eat for the sake of eating, should not not eat for the sake of not eating, should not sleep for the sake of sleeping, should not not sleep for the sake of not sleeping, should not speak for the sake of speaking, and should not be silent for the sake of being silent.

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu @109a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu @109a *//
translated: Blessed One,

original: phyin pa la spyod pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur pa lags /
analyzed: phyin pa la spyod pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur pa lags /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom complete the cultivation of the perfection of generosity?

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba lags /
translated: How do they complete the cultivation of the perfection of ethical discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'i tshe /
translated: “Subhūti, here when bodhisattva great beings are giving gifts,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo zhing sbyin pa de dag yongs su gtong ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo zhing sbyin pa de dag yongs su gtong ste /
translated: they give those gifts while dedicating them to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro; ;rab 'byor /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro; ;rab 'byor /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being’s cultivation of the perfection of generosity is completed.

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, how is it that the bodhisattva great beings’ cultivation of the perfection of morality is completed?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims srung ba'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims srung ba'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, here when the bodhisattva great beings are protecting morality,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo zhing tshul khrims de dag srung ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo zhing tshul khrims de dag srung ste /
translated: they protect that morality by dedicating it to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: In this way,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings’ cultivation of the perfection of morality is completed.

original: rab 'byor / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems @109b dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems @109b dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings’ cultivation of the perfection of patience become complete?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa bsgrub pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa bsgrub pa'i tshe /
translated: “Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings are practicing patience,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo zhing bzod pa de bsgom ste /🔽rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo zhing bzod pa de bsgom ste / rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: they cultivate patience while dedicating it to the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Subhūti, in that way bodhisattva great beings’ cultivation of the perfection of patience becomes complete.

original: rab 'byor / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings’ cultivation of the perfection of perseverance become complete?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i tshe rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo zhing brtson 'grus de brtsom ste /🔽rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i tshe rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo zhing brtson 'grus de brtsom ste / rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Lord: Here the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in perfect wisdom, should, when he begins to exert vigour, dedicate that wholesome root to full enlightenment, and he should do so in such a way that he does not review even that wholesome root.

original: rab 'byor / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /🔽rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na / rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhuti: How does the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in perfect wisdom, fulfil the perfection of meditation?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo zhing bsam gtan de dag la snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo zhing bsam gtan de dag la snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: The Lord: Here the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in perfect wisdom, should, when he begins to enter on the trances, dedicate that wholesome root to full enlightenment, and he should do so in such a way that he does not review even that wholesome root.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems @110a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems @110a *//
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being’s

translated: cultivation of the perfection of concentration is perfected.🔽“Subhūti, how is it that the bodhisattva great beings’🔽cultivation of the perfection of wisdom is perfected?

original: rab 'byor / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /🔽rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na / rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings cultivate the perfection of wisdom,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo zhing shes rab de bsgom ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo zhing shes rab de bsgom ste /
translated: they cultivate that wisdom while dedicating it to the knowledge of all aspects.🔽In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings’🔽cultivation of the perfection of wisdom is perfected.”🔽Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:🔽“Lord, if the perfection of wisdom is not made,

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: not unmade,🔽not defiled,🔽not purified,🔽not diminished,🔽not increased,🔽not past,🔽not future,🔽and not present,🔽how can the perfection of wisdom be made?🔽How can the perfection of wisdom be unmade?🔽How can the perfection of wisdom be defiled?🔽How can the perfection of wisdom be purified?🔽How can the perfection of wisdom be diminished?🔽How can the perfection of wisdom be increased?🔽How can the perfection of wisdom be past?🔽How can the perfection of wisdom be future?🔽How can the perfection of wisdom be present?”🔽The Lord said, “Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom is not made,🔽not unmade,🔽not defiled,

analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: not purified,🔽not diminished,🔽not increased,🔽not past,🔽not future,🔽and not present.🔽Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom is not made because form is not made.🔽The perfection of wisdom is not unmade because form is not unmade.🔽The perfection of wisdom is not defiled because form is not defiled.🔽The perfection of wisdom is not purified because form is not purified.🔽The perfection of wisdom is not diminished because form is not diminished.🔽The perfection of wisdom is not increased because form is not increased.🔽The perfection of wisdom is not past because form is not past.🔽The perfection of wisdom is not future because form is not future.🔽The perfection of wisdom is not present because form is not present.🔽Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom is not made because feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not made.🔽The perfection of wisdom is not unmade because feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not unmade.🔽The

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: Blessed One,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings, while standing in the perfection of generosity, take up the perfection of morality?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa yongs su gtong zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa yongs su gtong zhing /
translated: “Su­bhūti, when great bodhisattva beings give gifts

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo pa'i tshe /
translated: and dedicate them toward unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment,

original: sems can rnams la byams pa'i lus kyi las dang / byams pa'i ngag gi las dang / byams pa'i yid kyi las nye bar gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can rnams la byams pa'i lus kyi las dang / byams pa'i ngag gi las dang / byams pa'i yid kyi las nye bar gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: they will be engaged in the activity of love with their physical actions, they will be engaged in the activity of love with their verbal actions, and they will be engaged in the activity of love with their mental actions.

original: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @110b chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @110b chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: At that time, the bodhisattva great beings will take up the perfection of morality.🔽He asked,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing; bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing; bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
translated: How do Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas, while standing in the perfection of giving, embrace the perfection of patience?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'i tshe /
translated: “Subhūti, here when Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas are giving gifts,

original: len pa rnams gshe zhing 'khyal la tshul ma yin pa'i tshig rtsub pos mi snyan par brjod kyang /
analyzed: len pa rnams gshe zhing 'khyal la tshul ma yin pa'i tshig rtsub pos mi snyan par brjod kyang /
translated: even if those who receive them scold them, abuse them, and speak unpleasantly to them with harsh words,

original: de de dag la gnod pa'i sems mi skyed de /
analyzed: de de dag la gnod pa'i sems mi skyed de /
translated: they do not give rise to a hostile mind toward them.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: Subhūti, in that way Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas, while standing in the perfection of giving, embrace the perfection of patience.”🔽He asked,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
translated: How do Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas, abiding in the perfection of giving, embrace the perfection of vigor?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'i tshe /
translated: “Subhūti, here when Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas are giving gifts,

original: len pa de dag gshe zhing 'khyal la tshul ma yin pa'i tshig rtsub pos mi snyan par brjod de /
analyzed: len pa de dag gshe zhing 'khyal la tshul ma yin pa'i tshig rtsub pos mi snyan par brjod de /
translated: those who receive them may scold, revile, and speak unpleasantly and harshly to them.

original: de ltar spyo ba dang / kyal ba dang / tshul ma yin pa'i tshig rtsub pos mi snyan par brjod kyang sbyin pa'i blo dang yongs su gtong ba'i blo nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar spyo ba dang / kyal ba dang / tshul ma yin pa'i tshig rtsub pos mi snyan par brjod kyang sbyin pa'i blo dang yongs su gtong ba'i blo nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Even though they are thus scolded, reviled, and spoken to unpleasantly and harshly, they think only of giving and of giving up.

original: bdag @111a *// gis ni sbyin pa yongs su gtang bar bya ste /
analyzed: bdag @111a *// gis ni sbyin pa yongs su gtang bar bya ste /
translated: ‘I should give gifts.🔽I should not not give gifts.’

original: bdag gis sbyin pa yongs su mi gtang bar mi bya'o zhes de lus dang sems kyis brtson 'grus bskyed de; rab 'byor /
analyzed: bdag gis sbyin pa yongs su mi gtang bar mi bya'o zhes de lus dang sems kyis brtson 'grus bskyed de; rab 'byor /
translated: They arouse vigor in body and mind.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, standing in the perfection of generosity, incorporates the perfection of perseverance.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
translated: how do bodhisattva mahāsattvas, standing in the perfection of generosity, incorporate the perfection of concentration?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'i tshe nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'i tshe nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva mahāsattvas, when giving a gift, do not dedicate it to the level of the śrāvakas

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yongs su mi bsngo'i /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yongs su mi bsngo'i /
translated: or the level of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: gzhan du na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la de'i sems 'jug ste /
analyzed: gzhan du na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la de'i sems 'jug ste /
translated: Rather, their minds are directed toward the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, do Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, abiding in the perfection of generosity,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: take hold of the perfection of concentration.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pas sbyin pa yongs su gtong zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pas sbyin pa yongs su gtong zhing /
translated: how do Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, through skillful means, give gifts

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
translated: and take hold of the perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / @111b 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa byin zhing sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / @111b 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa byin zhing sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, here when Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas give gifts and practice generosity,

original: de rtag tu sbyin pa la sgyu ma'i blo nye bar gnas shing sbyin pa des sems can gang la'ang phan pa'am mi phan par 'gyur ba mi mthong ste /
analyzed: de rtag tu sbyin pa la sgyu ma'i blo nye bar gnas shing sbyin pa des sems can gang la'ang phan pa'am mi phan par 'gyur ba mi mthong ste /
translated: they always have an illusory understanding of giving, and do not see that any sentient being is benefited or harmed by that giving.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, skilled in means, standing in the perfection of generosity, incorporates the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines,

original: le'u lnga bcu gcig pa'o ////
analyzed: le'u lnga bcu gcig pa'o ////
translated: the eleventh chapter is called “Incorporation.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord!

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
translated: How do bodhisattva mahāsattvas, standing in the perfection of morality, incorporate the perfection of generosity?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ni /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva mahāsattvas standing in the perfection of morality

original: lus sam / ngag gam /
analyzed: lus sam / ngag gam /
translated: do not give rise to thoughts of body,

original: sems kyi sdom pa gang yang rung ste /🔽sdom pa des nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: sems kyi sdom pa gang yang rung ste / sdom pa des nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: Whatever the mental vow,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la reg par mi byed de /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la reg par mi byed de /
translated: he does not touch the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level with that vow.

original: de tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing sems can rnams kyi srog mi gcod do //
analyzed: de tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing sems can rnams kyi srog mi gcod do //
translated: Abiding in the perfection of morality, he does not kill living beings.

original: ma byin par mi len to //
analyzed: ma byin par mi len to //
translated: He does not take what has not been given.

original: 'dod pas log par mi g-yem mo //🔽rdzun @112a *// gyi tshig mi smra'o //
analyzed: 'dod pas log par mi g-yem mo // rdzun @112a *// gyi tshig mi smra'o //
translated: He does not engage in sexual misconduct.🔽He does not speak falsely.

original: phra ma'i tshig mi smra'o //🔽zhe gcod pa'i tshig rtsub mo mi smra'o //
analyzed: phra ma'i tshig mi smra'o // zhe gcod pa'i tshig rtsub mo mi smra'o //
translated: He does not speak divisively.🔽He does not speak harshly.

original: tshig kyal pa mi smra'o //
analyzed: tshig kyal pa mi smra'o //
translated: He does not speak meaninglessly.

original: chags sems su mi byed do //
analyzed: chags sems su mi byed do //
translated: He does not have a covetous mind.

original: gnod sems su mi byed do //
analyzed: gnod sems su mi byed do //
translated: He does not have a harmful mind.

original: log par mi lta'o //
analyzed: log par mi lta'o //
translated: He does not have a mind of wrong views.

original: de tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la gnas shing /🔽zas 'dod pa la zas /🔽skom 'dod pa la skom /
analyzed: de tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la gnas shing / zas 'dod pa la zas / skom 'dod pa la skom /
translated: Abiding in that perfection of morality,🔽he gives food to those who want food,

original: bzhon pa 'dod pa la bzhon pa /
analyzed: bzhon pa 'dod pa la bzhon pa /
translated: drink to those who want drink,🔽vehicles to those who want vehicles,

original: gos 'dod pa la gos /🔽me tog 'dod pa la me tog /🔽phreng ba 'dod pa la phreng ba /
analyzed: gos 'dod pa la gos / me tog 'dod pa la me tog / phreng ba 'dod pa la phreng ba /
translated: clothes to those who want clothes,🔽flowers to those who want flowers,🔽garlands to those who want garlands,

original: spos 'dod pa la spos /
analyzed: spos 'dod pa la spos /
translated: incense to those who want incense,

original: byug pa 'dod pa la byug pa /
analyzed: byug pa 'dod pa la byug pa /
translated: to those who want ointments, ointments;

original: mal cha 'dod pa la mal cha /
analyzed: mal cha 'dod pa la mal cha /
translated: to those who want beds, beds;

original: gnas 'dod pa la gnas /🔽'tsho ba 'dod pa la 'tsho ba /
analyzed: gnas 'dod pa la gnas / 'tsho ba 'dod pa la 'tsho ba /
translated: to those who want dwellings, dwellings;🔽to those who want livelihood, livelihood;

original: yo byad 'dod pa la yo byad yongs su gtong ba nas /
analyzed: yo byad 'dod pa la yo byad yongs su gtong ba nas /
translated: to those who want necessities, necessities;

original: mi'i yo byad gang ci'ang rung ba'i bar du 'dod pa rnams la mi'i mo byad gang ci'ang rung ba dag yongs su gtong zhing /
analyzed: mi'i yo byad gang ci'ang rung ba'i bar du 'dod pa rnams la mi'i mo byad gang ci'ang rung ba dag yongs su gtong zhing /
translated: to those who want any kind of human necessities, any kind of human necessities.

original: sbyin pa de ltar gtong ba'i tshe /
analyzed: sbyin pa de ltar gtong ba'i tshe /
translated: And when he gives that gift,

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o // de'ang ci nas kyang bsngo ba des nyan thos kyi sa'am /

analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi 'gyur ba de ltar yongs su bsngo ste /

analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /

analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: they appropriate the perfection of giving.

translated: how do bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of morality appropriate the perfection of patience?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa'i drung du sems can thams cad lhags nas yan lag dang / nyid lag rnams bcad gtubs te dong yang de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'khrug pa med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa'i drung du sems can thams cad lhags nas yan lag dang / nyid lag rnams bcad gtubs te dong yang de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'khrug pa med de /
translated: The Lord said, “Subhūti, here when all beings have come up to a bodhisattva great being standing in the perfection of morality and cut off and chopped off his limbs and appendages and left, the bodhisattva great being does not get upset,

original: gnod pa'i sems gcig kyang mi skyed do //
analyzed: gnod pa'i sems gcig kyang mi skyed do //
translated: does not generate even one thought of harm,

original: gzhan du na de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gzhan du na de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: but thinks like this:

original: de ltar sems can thams cad kyis bdag gi yan lag dang nyid lag rnams bcad gtubs te /
analyzed: de ltar sems can thams cad kyis bdag gi yan lag dang nyid lag rnams bcad gtubs te /
translated: ‘All beings have cut off and chopped off my limbs and appendages

original: dong ba ni bdag gis thob par bya ba legs par thob bo //
analyzed: dong ba ni bdag gis thob par bya ba legs par thob bo //
translated: “I have attained what I had to attain.

original: bdag gi lus rul pa 'di yongs su btang bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku lha rdzas kyi rdo rje las byung ba thob par bya'o snyam ste /
analyzed: bdag gi lus rul pa 'di yongs su btang bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku lha rdzas kyi rdo rje las byung ba thob par bya'o snyam ste /
translated: By giving away this body of mine, which is subject to decay, I will attain the body of a Tathāgata, which is born from the Dharma and is indestructible.”

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: Subhūti, in this way the bodhisattva great beings, standing in the perfection of morality,

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin to //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin to // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: take hold of the perfection of patience.

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Lord, how do the bodhisattva great beings, standing in the perfection of morality, take hold of the perfection of perseverance?”

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems @113a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems @113a *//
translated: The Lord said, “Subhūti, here the bodhisattva great beings, standing in the perfection of morality,

original: dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing sems can thams cad bdag gis 'khor ba las bsgral te /
analyzed: dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing sems can thams cad bdag gis 'khor ba las bsgral te /
translated: The great being, abiding in the perfection of morality, does not let his physical and mental vigor decline, thinking, “I must liberate all sentient beings from cyclic existence

original: 'chi ba med pa'i dbyings su dgod par bya'o zhes lus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus nyams par mi byed cing /
analyzed: 'chi ba med pa'i dbyings su dgod par bya'o zhes lus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus nyams par mi byed cing /
translated: and lead them to the expanse of reality that is free from birth and death.”

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: And he dedicates that wholesome action to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: ci nas kyang gang yongs su bsngo ba dang / ci yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang la yongs su bsngo ba'i blo rnam pa gsum du mi 'gyur ba de ltar yongs su bsngo ste /

analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /

analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: embraces the perfection of vigor.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /

analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

translated: “Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings enter into the first concentration, enter into the second concentration, enter into the third concentration, enter into the fourth concentration, up to and enter into the cessation concentration,🔽they do not focus on the śrāvaka level or

translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being, standing in the perfection of morality,

analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: embraces the perfection of concentration.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /

analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings, standing in the perfection of morality,🔽do not see any dharma as compounded,🔽do not see any dharma as uncompounded,

analyzed: mtshan ma yod pa 'dus byas su mi mthong /
translated: do not see any existent thing as uncompounded,🔽do not

analyzed: mtshan ma med pa 'dus ma byas su mi mthong / gzhan dun chos gang yang de bzhin nyid las 'da' ba med pa las phar chos gang yang yod pa'am /

original: med par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: med par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Elsewhere, they do not see any dharma as transcending suchness, nor do they see any dharma as existent or nonexistent.

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thabs mkhas pa des nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung @114a *// ste; rab 'byor /
translated: With that perfection of wisdom and skill in means, they do not fall to the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: take hold of the perfection of wisdom.🔽Subhūti asked,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of patience

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
translated: take hold of the perfection of generosity?”🔽The Blessed One said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: Subhuti: Here a Bodhisattva, from the first thought of enlightenment onwards,

original: snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'i tshe /
analyzed: snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'i tshe /
translated: when he gives a gift,

original: sems can thams cad gshe zhing 'khyal la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad gshe zhing 'khyal la /
translated: even if all beings should revile and abuse him,

original: yan lag dang nying lag gcod par gyur kyang /
analyzed: yan lag dang nying lag gcod par gyur kyang /
translated: cut off and chop off his limbs and organs,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: then the Bodhisattva, the great being, who stands in the perfection of patience, thinks to himself:

original: sems can 'di dag la ni bdag gis sbyin pa yongs su gtang bar bya'i /🔽sbyin pa yongs su mi gtang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes te /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag la ni bdag gis sbyin pa yongs su gtang bar bya'i / sbyin pa yongs su mi gtang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes te /
translated: “I must give gifts to these beings, I must not withhold them.🔽”

original: de sems can de dag zas 'dod pa la ni zas /
analyzed: de sems can de dag zas 'dod pa la ni zas /
translated: He gives food to those who need food,

original: skom 'dod pa la ni skom /🔽bzhon pa 'dod pa la ni bzhon pa /
analyzed: skom 'dod pa la ni skom / bzhon pa 'dod pa la ni bzhon pa /
translated: drink to those who need drink,🔽vehicles to those who need vehicles,

original: gos 'dod pa ni gos /🔽me tog 'dod pa la ni me tog /
analyzed: gos 'dod pa ni gos / me tog 'dod pa la ni me tog /
translated: clothes to those who need clothes,🔽flowers to those who need flowers,

original: phreng ba 'dod pa la ni phreng ba /
analyzed: phreng ba 'dod pa la ni phreng ba /
translated: garlands to those who need garlands,

original: spos 'dod pa la ni spos /🔽byug pa 'dod pa @114b la ni byug pa /
analyzed: spos 'dod pa la ni spos / byug pa 'dod pa @114b la ni byug pa /
translated: to those who want incense, incense;🔽to those who want ointments, ointments;

original: mal cha 'dod pa la ni mal cha /
analyzed: mal cha 'dod pa la ni mal cha /
translated: to those who want bedding, bedding;

original: gnas 'dod pa la ni gnas /
analyzed: gnas 'dod pa la ni gnas /
translated: to those who want shelter, shelter;

original: 'tsho ba 'dod pa la ni 'tsho ba /🔽yo byad 'dod pa la mi'i yo byad gang ci'ang rung ba'i bar du yongs su gtong ste; dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing /
analyzed: 'tsho ba 'dod pa la ni 'tsho ba / yo byad 'dod pa la mi'i yo byad gang ci'ang rung ba'i bar du yongs su gtong ste; dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing /
translated: to those who want livelihood, livelihood;🔽to those who want any kind of human necessities, any kind of human necessities.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: And he dedicates those wholesome roots to the knowledge of all aspects,

original: ci nas kyang gang yongs su bsngo ba dang / ci yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang la yongs su bsngo ba'i blo rnam pa gsum du mi 'gyur ba de ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: ci nas kyang gang yongs su bsngo ba dang / ci yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang la yongs su bsngo ba'i blo rnam pa gsum du mi 'gyur ba de ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: and he dedicates them in such a way that the three ideas of a dedicator, something to be dedicated, and a recipient of the dedication do not occur.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: In that way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of patience incorporate the perfection of giving.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings, while standing in the perfection of patience, embrace the perfection of discipline?🔽”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: “Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings, from the time when they first begin to set their mind on enlightenment,

original: snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du sems can yin no cog gi srog mi gcod do //
analyzed: snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du sems can yin no cog gi srog mi gcod do //
translated: until they are seated at the Focal Point of Enlightenment, do not take the lives of any living creatures.

original: ma byin par mi len to //
analyzed: ma byin par mi len to //
translated: They do not take what is not given.

original: 'dod pas log par mi g-yem mo //
analyzed: 'dod pas log par mi g-yem mo //
translated: They do not engage in sexual misconduct.

original: rdzun gyi tshig mi smra'o //🔽phra ma'i tshig mi smra'o //🔽zhe gcod pa'i tshig mi smra'o //
analyzed: rdzun gyi tshig mi smra'o // phra ma'i tshig mi smra'o // zhe gcod pa'i tshig mi smra'o //
translated: They do not speak falsely.🔽They do not speak divisively.🔽They do not speak harshly.

original: tshig kyal pa mi smra'o //🔽chags sems su mi byed do //🔽gnod sems @115a *//
analyzed: tshig kyal pa mi smra'o // chags sems su mi byed do // gnod sems @115a *//
translated: They do not engage in idle talk.🔽They do not have covetous minds.

original: su mi byed do //
analyzed: su mi byed do //
translated: They do not have malicious minds.

original: log par mi lta'o //
analyzed: log par mi lta'o //
translated: They do not have wrong views.

original: de'i sems kyang nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: de'i sems kyang nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: Their minds do not fall into the level of the śrāvakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la mi 'jug ste /
translated: and does not enter the level of a pratyekabuddha.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de'ang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de'ang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te /
translated: He makes common cause with all sentient beings with that wholesome root,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo ste /
translated: and dedicates it to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: ci nas kyang gang yongs su bsngo ba dang / ci yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang la yongs su bsngo ba'i blo rnam pa gsum du mi 'gyur ba de ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: ci nas kyang gang yongs su bsngo ba dang / ci yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang la yongs su bsngo ba'i blo rnam pa gsum du mi 'gyur ba de ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: He dedicates it in such a way that the three thoughts do not occur: ‘I should dedicate,’ ‘this is what I should dedicate,’ and ‘I should dedicate this to that.’

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: Subhūti, in that way bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of patience

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: take up the perfection of morality.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Lord,

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of patience

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
translated: take up the perfection of perseverance?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings, abiding in the perfection of patience,

original: brtson 'grus 'di lta bu yongs su bskyed de /
analyzed: brtson 'grus 'di lta bu yongs su bskyed de /
translated: generate this kind of effort:

original: bdag gis dpag tshad dam /
analyzed: bdag gis dpag tshad dam /

original: dpag tshad brgya'am /🔽dpag tshad stong ngam /
analyzed: dpag tshad brgya'am / dpag tshad stong ngam /
translated: or a hundred thousand leagues,🔽or ten million leagues,🔽or a hundred thousand million leagues,🔽or a billion leagues,🔽or a hundred billion leagues,🔽or a trillion leagues,

analyzed: dpag tshad brgya phrag stong ngam /
translated: or a hundred trillion leagues,🔽or a quadrillion leagues,

original: dpag tshad bye ba'am /🔽dpag tshad bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi bar ram /
analyzed: dpag tshad bye ba'am / dpag tshad bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi bar ram /

analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams brgya'am / 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi bar du song ste /
